1738.description: As introduced, makes various changes to the board of judicial conduct, including expanding the board's jurisdiction to include administrative law judges, judicial commissioners, magistrates, referees, special masters, hearing officers, and worker's compensation judges. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 2.

1739.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1739.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to the department of education.
1739.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner to employ three assistant commissioners to provide specialized support to local education agencies based on the rural, urban, or suburban areas served by the LEA. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1740.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1740.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 1 and Title 49, relative to higher education.
1740.description: As introduced, authorizes full-time public school teachers to enroll in one course at any state-supported college or university without having to pay tuition and fees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 1 and Title 49.

1742.last_action: Assigned to s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee
1742.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 6, relative to the sales and use tax.
1742.description: As introduced, reduces the state sales and use tax rate from 7 percent to 6 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

1743.last_action: Rec. for pass; ref to Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1743.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to school meals.
1743.description: As introduced, requires each local school board to establish a school lunch program and a school breakfast program that provides a free breakfast and lunch to each student enrolled in a school under the board's jurisdiction; requires the state to reimburse each LEA the cost of providing a free breakfast and lunch to each student enrolled in the LEA after all available federal funds have been applied. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1744.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1744.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-6-228, relative to food and food ingredients.
1744.description: As introduced, exempts the retail sale of fruit and vegetables for human consumption from the food retail sales tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-228.

1746.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 68, Chapter 7, relative to qualifying medical diagnoses for the use of medical cannabis.
1746.description: As enacted, adds quadriplegia as a qualifying medical condition for the lawful possession of cannabis oil. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 68, Chapter 7.

1748.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 20, relative to state agencies.
1748.description: As enacted, provides that in interpreting a state statute or rule, a court presiding over the appeal of a judgment in a contested case must not defer to a state agency's interpretation of the statute or rule and must interpret the statute or rule de novo; after applying all customary tools of interpretation, the court must resolve any remaining ambiguity against increased agency authority. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 20.

1749.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 44, relative to public meetings.
1749.description: As introduced, removes authorization for certain municipalities to hold public meetings in which some members of the governing body are participating electronically; adds requirements for notice, public access, and public participation for public meetings of governing bodies of state boards, agencies, and commissions in which some members are participating electronically; removes a member of such governing body if the member physically attends less than 50 percent of the body's meetings in a two-year period. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44.

1750.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Insurance Subcommittee of Insurance Committee
1750.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to health insurance.
1750.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to make the prescribed claim forms for reporting by healthcare providers available to healthcare providers on the department's website. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71.

1751.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1751.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to health care.
1751.description: As introduced, prohibits a health benefit plan from denying coverage for emergency services obtained in certain medical facilities. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

1752.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1752.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60, relative to assessments.
1752.description: As introduced, requires TCAP tests to be administered in a paper format for students in grades three through eight; allows the commissioner of education to determine whether end-of-course assessments must be administered in a computerized, online, or paper format; allows an LEA or public charter school to administer end-of-course assessments in a paper format if it objects to administering end-of-course assessments in a computerized or online format. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.

1755.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee of Criminal Justice Committee
1755.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 10 and Title 55, Chapter 50, relative to the offense of driving while license cancelled, suspended, or revoked.
1755.description: As introduced, authorizes the issuance of citation in lieu of arrest for the offense of driving on canceled, suspended, or revoked license; makes various other changes regarding such offense. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

1756.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, Chapter 25, Part 1, relative to trade practices.
1756.description: As introduced, prohibits agreements or arrangements that have the effect of lessening competition for, or controlling prices of, services held out as generally available to the public; prohibits a news organization from refusing to provide news and information to a news distribution product or service that is a willing buyer for such news and information; makes other related changes. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 25, Part 1.

1757.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 14; Title 29, Chapter 31; Title 33; Title 34, Chapter 6, Part 4; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 37, Chapter 10; Title 39; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to minors.
1757.description: As introduced, prohibits healthcare providers from providing medical treatment to minors without parental consent; provides exceptions for minors seeking treatment under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 14; Title 29, Chapter 31; Title 33; Title 34, Chapter 6, Part 4; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 37, Chapter 10; Title 39; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

1758.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1758.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to bereavement leave.
1758.description: As introduced, authorizes bereavement leave for employees of an LEA for the death of an immediate family member of the employee or for the death of an employee or student of the LEA. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1759.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5, relative to employment records.
1759.description: As enacted, clarifies that certain personal information of public employees maintained by an employing governmental entity or person is confidential. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

1760.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
1760.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1, relative to offenses against sporting officials.
1760.description: As introduced, establishes that assault against a sports official while the official is officiating a sporting event is a Class E felony or Class A misdemeanor, depending on the nature of the assault. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

1761.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1761.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 19 and Title 63, Chapter 7, relative to federally qualified health centers.
1761.description: As introduced, permits advanced practice nurses and physician assistants who are prescribers at federally qualified health centers to arrange for chart review by and site visits with certain collaborating physicians by means of HIPAA-compliant electronic information systems. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 19 and Title 63, Chapter 7.

1762.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 63, relative to drug paraphernalia.
1762.description: As enacted, expands the definition of drug paraphernalia to include pill press devices and pieces of a pill press device, unless the pill press device or piece is used by a person or entity that lawfully possesses drug products in the course of legitimate business activities, including a pharmacy or pharmacist licensed by the board of pharmacy; a wholesale drug distributor, or its agents, licensed by the board of pharmacy; and a manufacturer of drug products, or its agents, licensed by the board of pharmacy. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 63.

1763.last_action: Assigned to s/c Business & Utilities Subcommittee
1763.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 65, relative to smart meters.
1763.description: As introduced, prohibits electric and natural gas utilities from using data or information acquired by a smart meter for a purpose other than billing the applicable customer. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 65.

1764.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 20; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 48, relative to causes of action.
1764.description: As enacted, specifies that a registered charitable organization providing food, housing, or shelter from adverse weather to the community is not liable for any loss, damages, injury, or death that results from providing such services unless the charitable organization's conduct constitutes gross negligence or willful and wanton misconduct. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 48.

1765.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1, relative to bail.
1765.description: As enacted, requires a court to revoke bail immediately, notwithstanding sentencing hearings, motions for a new trial, or related post-guilt determination hearings, for a defendant who is convicted of continuous sexual abuse of a child. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

1766.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1766.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39 and Title 40, relative to release eligibility.
1766.description: As introduced, requires a person convicted of aggravated assault or aggravated robbery, committed on or after July 1, 2022, to serve 100 percent of the sentence imposed by the court, or no less than 85 percent of the sentence imposed by the court less sentence reduction credits earned and retained. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

1767.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Civil Justice Committee
1767.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 21, relative to fees.
1767.description: As introduced, authorizes a court clerk to charge a printing fee of 50 cents per page for electronic filings for the purpose of printing a paper copy of the filing to be kept in the clerk's file; prohibits charging the fee in the case of party who is indigent. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.

1768.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 7 and Title 39, relative to justification excluding criminal responsibility.
1768.description: As introduced, requires a court to order the state to reimburse a criminal defendant for all reasonable costs incurred in defense if the defendant was charged with a criminal homicide offense and found not guilty due to the justification of self-defense and the trier of fact determines that the defendant proved the self-defense claim by a preponderance of the evidence; authorizes the court to order the state or the prosecuting attorney, in their individual capacity, to pay damages for malicious prosecution. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 7 and Title 39.

1769.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Business & Utilities Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
1769.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40 and Title 66, relative to housing for persons with a prior criminal conviction.
1769.description: As introduced, prohibits a landlord from refusing to rent, lease, or otherwise extend housing opportunities to a person solely because the person was previously convicted of a criminal offense if the conviction was for an offense other than a violent offense, sexual offense, or violent sexual offense and the conviction occurred more than five years before the refusal. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 66.

1770.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 47 and Title 65, relative to social media.
1770.description: As introduced, designates social media platforms as common carriers and requires the entities to obtain certificates of public convenience and necessity from the Tennessee public utilities commission; prescribes fines against social media platforms that deplatform and shadow ban users based on political ideology, viewpoint, or personal animus. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 47 and Title 65.

1772.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1772.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 11, Part 7, relative to the advisory board for rehabilitation centers.
1772.description: As introduced, extends the advisory board for rehabilitation centers to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 11, Part 7.

1773.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 11, Part 3, relative to the applied behavior analyst licensing committee of the board of examiners in psychology.
1773.description: As enacted, extends the applied behavior analyst licensing committee of the board of examiners in psychology to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 11, Part 3.

1774.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 6, relative to the archaeological advisory council.
1774.description: As enacted, extends the archaeological advisory council to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 6.

1775.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 24, relative to the board of athletic trainers.
1775.description: As enacted, extends the board of athletic trainers to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 24.

1776.description: As enacted, extends the board of dietitian/nutritionist examiners to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 25.

1777.description: As enacted, extends the board of examiners for nursing home administrators to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 16.

1778.description: As enacted, extends the board of parole to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 1.

1779.description: As enacted, extends the board of respiratory care to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 27.

1780.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, relative to the bureau of TennCare within the department of finance and administration.
1780.description: As enacted, extends the bureau of TennCare within the department of finance and administration to June 30, 2025. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71.

1781.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 65, relative to the consumer advocate division in the office of the attorney general and reporter.
1781.description: As enacted, extends the consumer advocate division in the office of the attorney general and reporter to June 30, 2024. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 65.

1782.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 17, relative to the council for licensing hearing instrument specialists.
1782.description: As enacted, extends the council for licensing hearing instrument specialists to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 17.

1783.description: As enacted, extends the council of certified professional midwifery to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 29.

1784.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1, relative to the council on children's mental health care.
1784.description: As enacted, extends the council on children's mental health care to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1.

1785.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, relative to the department of agriculture.
1785.description: As enacted, extends the department of agriculture to June 30, 2026; requires the department to report back to the commerce, labor, transportation and agriculture joint evaluation committee by December 31, 2022, to update the committee on its progress in addressing the findings set forth in the August 2021 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

1786.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, relative to the department of education.
1786.description: As enacted, extends the department of education to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

1787.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, relative to the department of human services.
1787.description: As enacted, extends the department of human services to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

1788.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 4, Chapter 29, relative to the department of revenue.
1788.description: As enacted, extends the department of revenue to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 4, Chapter 29.

1789.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, relative to the department of tourist development.
1789.description: As enacted, extends the department of tourist development to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

1790.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, relative to the department of veterans services.
1790.description: As enacted, extends the department of veterans services to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

1791.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 38, Chapter 12, relative to the domestic violence state coordinating council.
1791.description: As enacted, extends the domestic violence state coordinating council to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 38, Chapter 12.

1792.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 19, relative to the Great Smoky Mountains Park commission.
1792.description: As enacted, extends the Great Smoky Mountains Park commission to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 19.

1793.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 13, Chapter 23, Part 1, relative to the housing development agency, board of directors.
1793.description: As enacted, extends the housing development agency, board of directors to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 13, Chapter 23, Part 1.

1794.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 9, relative to the Interstate Compact on Mental Health.
1794.description: As enacted, extends the Interstate Compact on Mental Health to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 9.

1795.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 4, Part 2, relative to the Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children.
1795.description: As enacted, extends the Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 4, Part 2.

1796.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 58, relative to the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact of 2007.
1796.description: As enacted, extends the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact of 2007 to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 58.

1797.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 6, Chapter 58; Title 11; Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5, relative to the local government planning advisory committee.
1797.description: As enacted, extends the local government planning advisory committee to June 30, 2025. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 6, Chapter 58; Title 11; Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

1798.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 21, relative to the pest control advisory board.
1798.description: As enacted, extends the pest control advisory board to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 21.

1800.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 12, relative to the school bond authority.
1800.description: As enacted, extends the school bond authority to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 12.

1801.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 7, relative to the Southeast Interstate Low-Level Radioactive Waste Compact.
1801.description: As enacted, extends the Southeast Interstate Low-Level Radioactive Waste Compact to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 7.

1802.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 62, Chapter 3 and Title 62, Chapter 4, relative to the state board of cosmetology and barber examiners.
1802.description: As enacted, extends the state board of cosmetology and barber examiners to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 62, Chapter 3 and Title 62, Chapter 4.

1803.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 2, relative to the state family support council.
1803.description: As enacted, extends the state family support council to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 2.

1804.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 2, relative to the state university and community college system, board of regents.
1804.description: As enacted, extends the state university and community college system, board of regents to June 30, 2026; extends video streaming and archiving requirements to meetings of the board's standing committees, in addition to meetings of the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 2.

1805.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 6, relative to the statewide planning and policy council for the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities.
1805.description: As enacted, extends the statewide planning and policy council for the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 33, Chapter 5, Part 6.

1806.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 7, relative to the Tellico Reservoir development agency.
1806.description: As enacted, extends the Tellico Reservoir development agency to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 7.

1807.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 10, relative to the Tennessee advisory committee for acupuncture.
1807.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee advisory committee for acupuncture to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 10.

1808.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 20, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29, relative to the Tennessee arts commission.
1808.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee arts commission to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 20, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.

1809.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 6, relative to the Tennessee center for earthquake research and information.
1809.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee center for earthquake research and information to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 6.

1810.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1810.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3, relative to the Tennessee emergency medical services board.
1810.description: As introduced, extends the Tennessee emergency medical services board to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3.

1811.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 13, relative to the Tennessee equine health advisory commission.
1811.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee equine health advisory commission to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 13.

1812.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50, relative to the Tennessee film, entertainment and music commission.
1812.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee film, entertainment and music commission to June 30, 2025. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50.

1813.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 70, relative to the Tennessee fish and wildlife commission.
1813.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee fish and wildlife commission to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 70.

1814.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 2, relative to the Tennessee higher education commission.
1814.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee higher education commission to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 2.

1815.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 12, relative to the Tennessee life and health insurance guaranty association.
1815.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee life and health insurance guaranty association to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 12.

1816.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 18, relative to the Tennessee massage licensure board.
1816.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee massage licensure board to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 18.

1817.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 29, relative to the Tennessee medical laboratory board.
1817.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee medical laboratory board to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 29.

1818.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 7, relative to the Tennessee rare disease advisory council.
1818.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee rare disease advisory council to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 7.

1819.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4, relative to the Tennessee rehabilitative initiative in correction board.
1819.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee rehabilitative initiative in correction board to June 30, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4.

1820.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 23, Part 2 and Title 4, Chapter 29, relative to the Tennessee residence commission.
1820.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee residence commission to June 30, 2030. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 23, Part 2 and Title 4, Chapter 29.

1821.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 14, relative to the Tennessee soil and water conservation commission.
1821.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee soil and water conservation commission to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 14.

1822.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 54, relative to the Tennessee sports hall of fame.
1822.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee sports hall of fame to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 54.

1823.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 2, relative to the Tennessee student assistance corporation, board of directors.
1823.description: As enacted, extends the Tennessee student assistance corporation, board of directors to June 30, 2026. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 2.

1824.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 9, relative to the water and wastewater operators, board of certification.
1824.description: As enacted, extends the water and wastewater operators, board of certification to June 30, 2028. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 9.

1825.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 9, relative to the West Fork Drakes Creek dam and reservoir interstate authority.
1825.description: As enacted, terminates the West Fork Drakes Creek dam and reservoir interstate authority with no wind down period. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 9.

1827.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1827.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, relative to oversight of governmental entities.
1827.description: As introduced, reduces from 10 to five business days after a death, the time within which the commissioner must report the death of a person in custody to members of the general assembly representing the legislative districts where the deceased person resided; requires that the information contained in the report include the name of the department facility where the death occurred. - Amends TCA Title 4.

1829.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 38; Title 39; Title 49; Title 50; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to gun violence.
1829.description: As introduced, requires certain departments to create programs to reduce gun violence in communities, including a youth employment program, violence intervention program, and firearm buyback program; requires the department of health to submit a quarterly report to the legislature and counties and municipalities on the effects of gun violence in communities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 38; Title 39; Title 49; Title 50; Title 68 and Title 71.

1830.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Business & Utilities Subcommittee
1830.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47; Title 49; Title 66 and Title 68, relative to building safety.
1830.description: As introduced, enacts the "Fuel Gas Detector Act"; requires the installation and maintenance of fuel gas detectors in rooms containing an appliance fueled by propane, natural gas, or any liquified petroleum gas for certain residential buildings. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 49; Title 66 and Title 68.

1831.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 16; Title 17 and Title 18, relative to judicial districts.
1831.description: As enacted, establishes an advisory task force to recommend a proposed statewide judicial redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16; Title 17 and Title 18.

1832.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5; Title 55 and Title 68, Chapter 211, relative to littering.
1832.description: As enacted, includes as a form of littering for any commercial purposes, which is considered aggravated criminal littering, the act of knowingly placing, dropping, or throwing two or more tires on public or private property without permission and without immediately removing the tires; punishable as a Class A misdemeanor or Class E felony based on weight/volume and prior convictions, except that a first offense involving more than eight tires placed, dropped, or thrown for a commercial purpose will be a Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5; Title 55 and Title 68, Chapter 211.

1833.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, relative to driving under the influence.
1833.description: As enacted, enacts "Ethan's, Hailey's, and Bentley's Law," which requires a sentencing court to order a defendant who has been convicted of vehicular homicide or aggravated vehicular homicide due to intoxication and in which the victim of the offense was the parent of a minor child to pay restitution in the form of child maintenance to each of the victim's children until each child reaches 18 years of age and has graduated from high school. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

1834.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
1834.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 4-21-401; Section 50-1-307 and Section 50-1-309, relative to rescue squad workers.
1834.description: As introduced, authorizes a volunteer rescue squad worker to respond to an emergency during the worker's regularly scheduled working hours without loss of pay, vacation time, sick leave, or earned overtime accumulation; authorizes such worker to take the worker's next shift off as a vacation or sick day without loss of pay under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 4-21-401; Section 50-1-307 and Section 50-1-309.

1835.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in K-12 Subcommittee
1835.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30, relative to classroom instruction.
1835.description: As introduced, requires each public high school to begin classroom instruction no earlier than 8:30 a.m. and each public middle school to begin classroom instruction no earlier than 8:00 a.m. beginning in the 2023-2024 school year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

1837.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, relative to the state board of education.
1837.description: As enacted, divides the appointing authority for each of the nine members of the board representing the state's nine congressional districts among the governor, the speaker of the senate, and the speaker of the house of representatives such that each appoints three members; revises the legislative confirmation process for members appointed on or after July 1, 2022; revises other appointment and confirmation related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.

1838.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Civil Justice Subcommittee of Civil Justice Committee
1838.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 16, Chapter 2, relative to judicial districts.
1838.description: As introduced, creates one additional circuit court each in the thirteenth, nineteenth, twenty-second, and twenty-third judicial districts; creates one additional chancery court in the nineteenth judicial district. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 2.

1839.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60, relative to Tri-Star Scholars.
1839.description: As enacted, includes students who fulfill the requirements of the Tennessee work ethic distinction program to receive recognition as a Tennessee Tri-Star scholar. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.

1840.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 56 and Section 63-1-155, relative to electronic delivery of health care.
1840.description: As introduced, extends the statutory provision regulating reimbursements for healthcare services provided during a telehealth encounter beyond April 1, 2022; tolls, for the duration of any state of emergency, the 16-month period that a provider can offer telemedicine services to the patient without having an in-person encounter. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Section 63-1-155.

1842.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 56, relative to telemedicine.
1842.description: As enacted, includes as provider-based telemedicine, which health insurance entities must cover, HIPAA-compliant audio-only conversation for the provision of healthcare services (in addition to behavioral health services as covered under existing law) when the use of HIPAA-compliant real-time, interactive video, video telecommunications, or electronic technology, or store-and-forward telemedicine services are unavailable. - Amends TCA Title 56.

1843.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 15, Chapter 2, relative to Economic Education Month.
1843.description: As enacted, designates the month of October annually as "Economic Education Month." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2.

1844.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 67, relative to the State Lending Transparency Act.
1844.description: As enacted, enacts the "State Lending Transparency Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 67.

1845.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1845.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-5-704, relative to tax relief for disabled veterans.
1845.description: As introduced, increases from $175,000 to $250,000 the first portion of home value for which property tax relief will be reimbursed to disabled veteran home owners. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.

1846.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9; Title 29 and Title 37, relative to civil liability of certain entities.
1846.description: As enacted, limits the liability of a person or entity that contracts with the department of children's services to provide foster care services to children in the department's custody in the same manner that the department's liability is limited from civil actions or claims filed by the children and families who are the intended or actual recipients of those services; specifies that a claim against the contractor arising from the contractor's provision of foster care continuum services to children in the department's custody must be filed with a court of competent jurisdiction and will not be heard by the claims commission. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 29 and Title 37.

1847.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to board member compensation.
1847.description: As enacted, requires that the compensation of county school board members be included in the school district budget submitted to the county legislative body, rather than being fixed by the county legislative body; prohibits reducing a county school board member’s compensation from the prior year; limits the amount of compensation paid to a county school board member to be no more than the compensation fixed for members of the county legislative body. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1848.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Education Instruction Subcommittee of Education Instruction
1848.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to testing.
1848.description: As introduced, authorizes an LEA to use the ACT, ACT Aspire, or SAT suites of assessments, instead of state-mandated assessments, to test students in grades 9-12 in the subjects of math and English language arts. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

1850.last_action: Assigned to s/c Agriculture & Natural Resources Subcommittee
1850.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 6; Title 7; Title 13 and Title 69, Chapter 3, relative to pump and haul systems.
1850.description: As introduced, prohibits the commissioner of environment and conservation from issuing a water quality state operating permit for a pump and haul system that is located in the urban growth boundary of a municipality without the approval of the legislative body for that municipality. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 13 and Title 69, Chapter 3.

1851.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 8-34-605, relative to military service credit in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system.
1851.description: As enacted, allows TCRS members who served in the armed forces during certain periods of armed conflict to establish retirement credit for the military service under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Section 8-34-605.

1852.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 12; Title 39; Title 50 and Title 67, relative to immigration.
1852.description: As enacted, lowers the threshold for private employers having to verify work authorization status of new hires through E-Verify from those with 50 or more employees to those with 35 or more employees; requires the office of employment verification assistance to offer, at no charge, E-Verify sign ups and work authorization status checks for employers with less than 35 employees; protects employers acting upon false results generated by E-Verify; prohibits certain wrongful or retaliatory discharge or discrimination actions; prohibits certain rehires. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 39; Title 50 and Title 67.

1854.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 53 and Title 55, relative to criminal law.
1854.description: As enacted, revises the penalties for continuous sexual abuse of a child to clarify circumstances under which the offense is a Class A, Class B, or Class C felony; adds to the list of offenses that warrant the Class A felony, trafficking for a commercial sex act if the victim is a minor and promoting prostitution if the victim is a minor. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 53 and Title 55.

1855.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9; Title 50 and Title 67, relative to labor.
1855.description: As introduced, prohibits receipt of state benefits to a business that fails to provide instruction or documents to employees on the right to designate a bargaining representative through secret ballot and the right to not be subject to unfair labor practices, and to grant equal access to its property to employees and proposed bargaining representatives named on an organization election ballot. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 50 and Title 67.

1857.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-5-1004, relative to forest land.
1857.description: As enacted, clarifies that the minimum size requirement of 15 acres for land to be eligible to be classified as forest land for purposes of assessment and reduced property taxes may be achieved with a single tract or with two noncontiguous tracts separated only by a road, body of water, or public or private easement. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1004.

1858.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2, relative to shelter for dogs.
1858.description: As introduced, establishes standards for shelter that must be provided to dogs under present animal cruelty laws, including requirements for ventilation, size, and the ability to retain body heat. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

1859.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, relative to performance measures.
1859.description: As enacted, allows teachers to use results from benchmark assessments, including, but not limited to, state-adopted benchmark assessments or a universal screener approved by the state board of education, to measure student achievement. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.

1860.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38; Title 54; Title 55; Title 68, Chapter 102 and Title 68, Chapter 140, relative to road safety.
1860.description: As introduced, requires employees and contractors of the department of transportation and first responders to wear blaze orange vests with reflective tape when working on roads and highways; prohibits all other colored vests; requires the department of safety to provide training on proper interstate incident traffic control to each police officer in a department that contains in its jurisdiction an interstate highway. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 54; Title 55; Title 68, Chapter 102 and Title 68, Chapter 140.

1861.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Higher Education Subcommittee of Education Administration
1861.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to assessments required for admission to a four-year public postsecondary institution.
1861.description: As introduced, requires, beginning with the 2022-2023 academic year, each four-year public institution of higher education to obtain the score of each student seeking admission to, or enrollment in, the institution as an entering freshman on a postsecondary readiness assessment or nationally recognized college admissions test before the student may be admitted or enrolled. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1862.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c K-12 Subcommittee of Education Administration
1862.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 12, relative to school personnel.
1862.description: As introduced, increases the number of BEP funded full-time public school nurse positions from one per 3,000 students to one per 750 students; increases the number of full-time public school nurses considered sufficient for the public school nurse program to adequately provide services from one nurse per 3,000 students to one nurse per 750 students; requires the BEP formula to fund full-time school counselor positions at a ratio of one per 250 students or one full-time school counselor position for each LEA, whichever is greater. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 12.

1863.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9, Chapter 21 and Section 12-10-116, relative to public finance.
1863.description: As enacted, authorizes capital outlay notes to be refunded with public building authority loans, subject to review by the comptroller; makes other revisions to provisions governing bonds and notes issued by local governments. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Section 12-10-116.

1864.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1864.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to high school credit.
1864.description: As introduced, requires LEAs to offer high school students high school credit for a course in which the student is not enrolled but for which the student has satisfied the course requirements through an examination. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1865.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36 and Title 37, relative to child custody.
1865.description: As enacted, adds as a factor to be considered by the court when determining the best interest of a child, in a proceeding requiring the court to make a custody determination regarding a minor child, whether a parent has failed to pay court-ordered child support for a period of three years or more. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.

1866.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 14, relative to COVID-19.
1866.description: As enacted, requires certain employers with a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy to grant exemptions based on medical reason or religious reason; makes other related changes. - Amends TCA Title 14.

1867.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, relative to instant runoff voting.
1867.description: As enacted, prohibits a county election commission from utilizing instant runoff voting or ranked choice voting to conduct an election in this state for a statewide or local government office. - Amends TCA Title 2.

1868.last_action: Failed in s/c Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee of Local Government Committee
1868.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 49, relative to elections.
1868.description: As introduced, requires county election commissions to designate public institutions of higher education with more than 20,000 enrolled students as polling places during early voting in federal and state general elections and presidential primaries for a period of at least three days; authorizes the institution to select the days for early voting. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 49.

1869.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
1869.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
1869.description: As introduced, prohibits a licensing board or disciplinary subcommittee from taking action against a physician's license based solely on the physician's recommendations to a patient regarding treatment for COVID-19 subject to certain conditions; prohibits a pharmacy from blocking or attempting to block a patient's access to COVID-19 treatments in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

1870.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 14; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
1870.description: As enacted, prohibits governmental entities, local education agencies, schools, and private businesses from adopting or enforcing laws, rules, or practices that fail to recognize acquired immunity as providing a level of immune protection that is at least as protective as a COVID-19 vaccine or treat individuals with acquired immunity differently than individuals who have received the COVID-19 vaccine. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 14; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

1872.last_action: Failed in s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
1872.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, Chapter 18, relative to payments by consumers.
1872.description: As introduced, prohibits a person selling or offering for sale goods or services at retail from requiring a buyer to pay using credit; requires a person selling or offering for sale goods or services at retail to accept legal tender when offered by the buyer as payment; violations treated as prohibited practice under Tennessee Consumer Protection Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

1874.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 49-1-301; Section 49-1-305 and Section 49-7-204, relative to ex officio members.
1874.description: As enacted, authorizes the executive director of the Tennessee higher education commission to appoint a designee to serve in the executive director's stead on the state board of education; authorizes the executive director of the state board of education to appoint a designee to serve in the executive director's stead on the Tennessee higher education commission. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-301; Section 49-1-305 and Section 49-7-204.

1875.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 120, relative to building regulations.
1875.description: As enacted, specifies that a statewide building construction standard or another standard or requirement adopted by a local government shall not prohibit or limit the use of equipment with refrigerants, if the equipment contains a refrigerant listed in accordance with safety standards imposed by federal law or rule and is installed in accordance with the use conditions imposed by federal law or rule. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120.

1876.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in State Government Committee
1876.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 3 and Title 49, relative to health coverage.
1876.description: As introduced, creates health savings accounts and flexible spending accounts for eligible instructional employees who do not enroll in a state or local health plan and meet federal requirements. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 3 and Title 49.

1877.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2, relative to sexual offenses.
1877.description: As enacted, expands the uses of sex offender registration fees available to the registering agency to include the investigation of sexual offenses and the purchase of specialized equipment for use in the investigation of sexual offenses in addition to paying the administrative costs of the sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

1878.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 9, relative to the Tennessee Literacy Success Act.
1878.description: As enacted, requires the comptroller to annually review and report on the implementation of the Tennessee Literacy Success Act and submit the report to the education committees of the house of representatives and senate and the state board of education and publish the report on the comptroller's website. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 9.

1879.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 44 and Title 49, Chapter 2, relative to local school board meetings.
1879.description: As introduced, requires local boards of education to provide an opportunity for at least 10 people to speak on any topic related to the board for at least three minutes per person at each public meeting and to provide an opportunity for people to submit written public comments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

1880.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1880.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 12, relative to a new parking garage for legislative employees. This act makes appropriations for a new parking garage for legislative employees for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2021, and July 1, 2022.
1880.description: As introduced, appropriates $15 million to the legislature for planning and construction of a new parking garage that has at least 400 parking spaces, is attached to the Cordell Hull Building, and is used solely by legislative employees. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 12.

1881.last_action: Failed in s/c Civil Justice Subcommittee of Civil Justice Committee
1881.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29, relative to contracts for snow removal and ice control services.
1881.description: As introduced, declares a provision in a snow removal and ice control services contract to be void and against public policy if the provision requires a service provider to indemnify, hold harmless, or insure the service receiver against damages arising out of bodily injury to persons, damage to property, or economic damages caused by the service receiver's negligence and the service provider has been directed by the service receiver not to perform the snow removal or ice control services. - Amends TCA Title 29.

1882.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 4, relative to forensic audits of elections.
1882.description: As introduced, requires the division of elections within the secretary of state's office to conduct random forensic audits of a selected number of counties and voting machine vendors after each statewide November general election, beginning in 2024. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 4.

1883.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29, Chapter 16 and Title 54, Chapter 14, relative to easements on private property.
1883.description: As enacted, provides that if a person who already possesses a private easement or right-of-way of less than 25 feet granted determines that additional land is needed for the purpose of extending utility lines to the enclosed land, then the person must file a new petition requesting additional land; enacts other related requirements in regard to such a petition. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 16 and Title 54, Chapter 14.

1884.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 12-10-109 and Title 42, relative to parking fee exemptions for military service members and veterans.
1884.description: As introduced, exempts certain motor vehicles from parking fees at airports in this state if the vehicle displays a disabled veteran or military award license plate. - Amends TCA Section 12-10-109 and Title 42.

1885.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1885.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39 and Title 40, relative to evading arrest.
1885.description: As introduced, allows the seizure and forfeiture of a vehicle used in the commission of the offense of evading arrest if the offense is committed while operating a motor vehicle and the person committing the offense is the owner of the motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

1886.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to response to instruction and intervention personnel.
1886.description: As introduced, requires the BEP formula to fund full-time response to instruction and intervention (RTI²) positions at a ratio of one per 1,000 students or one full-time RTI² position for each LEA, whichever is greater. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1888.last_action: Assigned to s/c Business & Utilities Subcommittee
1888.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 62, Chapter 13, Part 3, relative to continuing education requirements.
1888.description: As introduced, exempts real estate brokers who are in good standing with the Tennessee real estate commission, have been licensed for at least 10 years, and have completed at least 200 hours of continuing education in real estate courses at a school, college, or university approved by the commission from continuing education requirement for license renewal. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13, Part 3.

1889.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to elementary schools.
1889.description: As enacted, redefines elementary school, for purposes of federal funding, as schools serving any combination of pre-kindergarten through grade six. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

1890.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 10, relative to coordinated school health.
1890.description: As enacted, requires the coordinated school health program to submit a mid-year report to the department of education to determine if funds within the program should be redistributed. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 10.

1891.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4, relative to blood alcohol or drug concentration test fees.
1891.description: As introduced, establishes a $150 fine for a person convicted of certain DUI offenses if the offense occurred in Perry County; requires any proceeds from the fine be used for the exclusive use of the county-operated ambulance service. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

1892.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1892.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-6-303, relative to exemption from sales tax on motor vehicles for certain Tennessee national guard members and employees.
1892.description: As introduced, extends the current sales tax exemption on motor vehicles purchased by members of the armed forces to Tennessee national guard military technicians and members of the Tennessee national guard who are on part-time duty; applies to one vehicle purchased during a five-year period. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-303.

1893.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to participation in athletics.
1893.description: As introduced, prohibits males from participating in public higher education sports that are designated for females; creates a cause of action for violations that deprive a student of an athletic opportunity or that cause direct or indirect harm to a student at the middle school, high school, or postsecondary level. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1894.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to school sports.
1894.description: As enacted, requires the commissioner of education to withhold a portion of the state education finance funds that an LEA is otherwise eligible to receive if the LEA fails or refuses to determine a student's gender, for purposes of participation in school sports, by the student's sex at the time of birth; exempts an LEA that fails or refuses to determine a student's gender, for purposes of participation in school sports, by the student's sex at the time of birth if the LEA's failure or refusal to do so is required by a court or other legally binding order. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

1895.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
1895.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, Chapter 20, Part 1, relative to parole considerations.
1895.description: As introduced, deletes the authority for the board of parole to determine when an inmate will begin service of the inmate's consecutive sentence, including allowing the inmate to begin custodial parole on any date on or after the custodial parole eligibility date. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 20, Part 1.

1896.last_action: Failed in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
1896.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 53, Chapter 11 and Title 63, relative to controlled substances.
1896.description: As introduced, requires employers of healthcare prescribers to report to the TBI and local law enforcement authorities, as well as the department of health, prescribers that acquire or attempt to acquire controlled substances by misrepresentation, fraud, forgery, deception, or subterfuge. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 53, Chapter 11 and Title 63.

1897.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10; Title 33; Title 36; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 70, relative to firearms.
1897.description: As introduced, renames enhanced and concealed handgun carry permits as enhanced and concealed firearm carry permits and authorizes a permit holder to carry any firearms, rather than handguns, that the permit holder legally owns or possesses; expands the circumstances in which a permit holder may carry a firearm. - Amends TCA Title 10; Title 33; Title 36; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 70.

1899.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1899.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 56, relative to reimbursement of assessment costs.
1899.description: As introduced, requires the department of education to establish a fund to reimburse educators in an amount equal to the cost of an assessment required for licensure if the educator receives a qualifying score on the required assessment. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 56.

1900.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to qualifications required to teach.
1900.description: As enacted, prohibits the granting of a temporary permit to teach a physical education class, special education course, or course for which an end-of-course examination is required; authorizes endorsement exemption to a teacher to teach any course or subject area, except a physical education class or a special education course, for the 2022-2023 and 2023-2024 school years; revises other related provisions; requires the department of education to report certain information regarding endorsement exemptions and temporary permits. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

1901.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 8 of the Private Acts of 1971; as amended by Chapter 204 of the Private Acts of 1982; Chapter 105 of the Private Acts of 1998; Chapter 69 of the Private Acts of 2000 and Chapter 78 of the Private Acts of 2002; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Highway Commission for Coffee County.
1901.description: Subject to local approval, requires that the boundaries of the districts of the Highway Commission conform to those of the Rural County Commission districts established by 2021 redistricting. - Amends Chapter 8 of the Private Acts of 1971; as amended.

1902.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 63, Chapter 5, relative to dental hygienists.
1902.description: As enacted, designates live, interactive webinars as in-person courses for the purposes of continuing education requirements. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 63, Chapter 5.

1903.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 122, relative to boilers.
1903.description: As enacted, exempts an autoclave that sterilizes reusable medical or dental equipment used by an entity or individual licensed under title 63 or title 68 from applicable clearance requirements if the autoclave is installed in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations; authorizes the board of boiler rules to waive or exempt a requirement regarding inspections for an autoclave, pursuant to the exemption. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 122.

1904.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to drug overdoses.
1904.description: As enacted, requires hospitals, clinics, and persons, including doctors and nurses, who are called upon to render aid to a person suffering from the effects of a fatal drug overdose to report the drug overdose to the appropriate chief of police or sheriff and district attorney general, to the extent allowed by state and federal law. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

1905.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 1, relative to liens.
1905.description: As enacted, specifies that, in addition to deeds of trust, deeds recorded prior to state liens for taxes or fees are superior to the state lien. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1.

1906.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1906.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 40, relative to diversion.
1906.description: As introduced, removes the requirement for a defendant to pay a fee of $100 to the Tennessee bureau of investigation upon the defendant's request for diversion. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 40.

1907.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1907.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41, relative to criminal law.
1907.description: As introduced, increases from 20 to 30 the number of days within which a sentencing court must hold a hearing to consider a petition requesting the denial of an offender's suspension of sentence based on the offender's threat to public safety as indicated by a pattern of prior violent or drug-related criminal behavior. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

1908.last_action: Assigned to s/c Education Instruction Subcommittee
1908.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 13, relative to public charter school enrollment.
1908.description: As introduced, authorizes a public charter school to enroll a school-age child who resides outside the geographic boundaries of the LEA in which the public charter school is located if the school-age child resides in a school district in which a public charter school is not located, regardless of the out-of-district enrollment policy, if any, of the LEA in which the public charter school is located. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

1909.last_action: Failed in s/c Agriculture & Natural Resources Subcommittee of Agriculture & Natural Resources Committee
1909.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 12, Part 1, relative to certified animal control agencies.
1909.description: As introduced, exempts a certified animal control agency administering vaccinations and microchip implants by or under the responsible supervision of a licensed veterinarian as a part of a community outreach program from premises permit requirements for premises where a licensed veterinarian practices or where the practice of veterinary medicine occurs. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12, Part 1.

1910.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Criminal Justice Subcommittee
1910.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2, relative to cock fighting.
1910.description: As introduced, raises from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony certain animal cruelty offenses involving a cock; requires a fine of not less than $1,000 nor more than $2,500 for the offense of being a spectator at a cock fight. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

1911.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to classroom instruction.
1911.description: As enacted, authorizes LEAs to provide up to two days of the required 180 days of classroom instruction through remote instruction in accordance with certain criteria. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

1912.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 41, Chapter 21, relative to deceased prisoners.
1912.description: As enacted, revises the manner in which the department may dispose of the unclaimed body of an inmate who dies in a penitentiary, including by way of cremation. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.

1913.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1913.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 7, relative to polling places.
1913.description: As introduced, prohibits a person convicted of a felony whose voting rights have not been restored from entering a polling place until such rights are restored; authorizes a county election commission to adopt a policy to credentialed members of the press for purposes of authorizing credentialed press members to access polling locations and take photographs and videos at such locations. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

1914.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1914.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9; Title 54 and Title 67, relative to transportation. This act makes appropriations for county roads and bridges for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2021, and July 1, 2022.
1914.description: As introduced, appropriates excess state tax revenues over-collected in fiscal year 2021–2022 to the department of transportation to be used for making grants in the amount of $2 million to each county highway department for the construction, repair, and improvement of county roads and bridges. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54 and Title 67.

1915.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 49 and Title 50, relative to state employment.
1915.description: As enacted, prohibits a state agency from requiring a baccalaureate degree as a condition of state employment unless the knowledge, skills, or abilities required for the position can only reasonably be obtained through a course of study culminating in a baccalaureate degree. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 49 and Title 50.

1916.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 11, relative to the applied behavioral analyst licensing committee.
1916.description: As enacted, authorizes a licensed assistant behavior analyst (LBA) to administer behavioral scales that are within the scope of the practice of applied behavior analysis. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 11.

1917.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 17, Chapter 2, relative to judicial officers.
1917.description: As enacted, authorizes a county legislative body to authorize the judges of the circuit and chancery courts to appoint masters for certain purposes. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 2.

1918.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 34; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 56; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to children.
1918.description: As introduced, prohibits taking custody of certain children transported across state lines without the written consent of the department of children's services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 34; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 56; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

1920.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 54, relative to the SSG Ryan C. Knaus Memorial Highway.
1920.description: As enacted, designates a segment of Tazewell Pike in Knox County as the "SSG Ryan C. Knauss Memorial Highway." - Amends TCA Title 54.

1921.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, relative to restrictions on sexual offenders.
1921.description: As enacted, prohibits a sexual offender, violent sexual offender, or a violent juvenile sexual offender, whose victim was a minor, from knowingly renting or offering for rent a swimming pool, hot tub, or other body of water to be used for swimming that is located on property owned or leased by the offender or otherwise under the control of the offender; creates defense for violation of certain existing restrictions that the offender was the parent of the minor in the offender's presence. - Amends TCA Title 40.

1922.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 65, relative to electric cooperatives.
1922.description: As introduced, authorizes a rural electric and community services cooperative to allow directors or cooperative members to participate in cooperative meetings by means of virtual or remote communication if certain conditions are met. - Amends TCA Title 65.

1923.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 10, relative to the nursing home assessment.
1923.description: As enacted, extends the nursing home annual assessment fee to June 30, 2023. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 10.

1924.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 56, relative to travel insurance.
1924.description: As enacted, makes changes to the definition of "travel insurance" and related terms; requires a travel insurer to pay premium taxes on travel insurance premiums paid by certain policyholders; makes other changes related to travel insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.

1925.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 36-3-301, relative to marriage.
1925.description: As introduced, authorizes current and former sheriffs, clerks of court, registers of deeds, assessors of property, and trustees of this state to solemnize the rite of matrimony. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-301.

1926.last_action: H. Placed on Regular Calendar for 4/27/2022
1926.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 38; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4; Title 39, Chapter 17; Title 43, Chapter 27; Title 53; Title 67 and Title 68, Chapter 7, relative to cannabis.
1926.description: As introduced, changes the date, from January 1 to January 15, by which the medical cannabis commission must submit its annual report to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 38; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4; Title 39, Chapter 17; Title 43, Chapter 27; Title 53; Title 67 and Title 68, Chapter 7.

1927.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 17, relative to elections.
1927.description: As introduced, prohibits a political party from requiring a person to pay a fee in order to run as that political party's candidate for public office. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 17.

1929.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to student discipline.
1929.description: As enacted, authorizes a local board of education or charter school governing body to implement, as part of the LEA's or public charter school's discipline policy, holistic programs of positive behavior reinforcement and reward-based behavior modification systems. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

1931.last_action: Assigned to s/c Children & Family Affairs Subcommittee
1931.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 36-1-142 and Section 68-11-255, relative to infants.
