1931.description: As introduced, expands the procedure for surrendering a newborn infant without criminal liability to include placement in a newborn safety device located at a continuously staffed police station, fire station, or hospital; allows either parent, rather than only a mother, to voluntarily surrender a newborn infant. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-142 and Section 68-11-255.

1932.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1932.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 69, relative to the use of state funds.
1932.description: As introduced, urges the department of transportation to report to the finance, ways and means committees and transportation committees the amount of state funds expended over the previous 10 fiscal years for maintenance of locks and dams on navigable rivers within this state, and the estimated amount of state funds necessary to properly maintain such locks and dams over the next 10 fiscal years. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 69.

1933.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Criminal Justice Committee
1933.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 13, relative to teachers.
1933.description: As introduced, extends application of the enhanced penalties for certain assaults against a first responder or nurse who is discharging or attempting to discharge official duties to assaults against teachers. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

1934.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 49-5-209, relative to the Educator's Bill of Rights.
1934.description: As enacted, names the statute delineating rights of an educator as the "Educator's Bill of Rights." - Amends TCA Section 49-5-209.

1935.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee of Criminal Justice Committee
1935.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 16 and Title 40, relative to bail bonds.
1935.description: As introduced, makes various changes to the requirements for bail, including stating that a defendant is entitled to a bail hearing to address any conditions of release within 48 hours of arrest or being held to answer for any bailable offense. - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 40.

1936.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7, relative to business tax.
1936.description: As enacted, requires, under the Business Tax Act, the department of revenue to make available to every person that files a return under the Act a certificate indicating whether the person reported the tax due for a location at the wholesaler rate or retailer rate. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

1938.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c K-12 Subcommittee of Education Administration
1938.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49 and Title 71, relative to funding positions in K-12 schools.
1938.description: As introduced, requires the department of human services to administer a grant program, using temporary assistance for needy families program funds, for LEAs to create certain positions. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

1939.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Civil Justice Subcommittee of Civil Justice Committee
1939.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 17, Chapter 5, relative to the Tennessee board of judicial conduct.
1939.description: As introduced, creates process for complainants aggrieved by a final decision of the board of judicial conduct to file a petition for review in chancery court; adds discriminatory acts by a judge based on gender or race as grounds for sanction by the board. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 17, Chapter 5.

1940.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Insurance Committee
1940.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 12, relative to automobile insurance coverage.
1940.description: As introduced, requires uninsured and underinsured motorist insurance to equal the minimum amount required for primary automobile liability insurance for a driver logged on to the transportation network company's digital network. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12.

1941.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 32, relative to holographic wills.
1941.description: As introduced, creates a presumption of suspicious circumstances if a holographic will is written within six months prior to a testator's death by suicide and places the burden of presenting evidence that the testator had the capacity to execute the will on the proponent of the will. - Amends TCA Title 32.

1942.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 34, Chapter 1, relative to tort settlements involving minors.
1942.description: As enacted, removes the requirement for court approval of a tort claim settlement involving a minor that is less than $10,000; revises other provisions regarding tort settlements involving minors. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 34, Chapter 1.

1943.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1943.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 9 and Title 49, relative to obscenity.
1943.description: As introduced, excludes local education agencies, public schools, and employees and private contractors of LEAs or public schools from the exception to certain obscenity offenses if the LEA, public school, employee, or private contractor possesses obscene material that is harmful to minors on public school premises; prohibits an LEA or public school from making obscene materials or materials harmful to minors available to students in the school libraries controlled by the LEA or public school. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 9 and Title 49.

1944.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to career readiness.
1944.description: As introduced, creates an option for LEAs to offer students enrolled in its high schools' career readiness opportunities, which include an opportunity to take a nationally recognized assessment that assesses a student's career readiness as approved by the department of education, instead of early postsecondary opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

1945.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 13; Title 39; Title 47; Title 66 and Title 71, relative to real property.
1945.description: As enacted, authorizes an offeree to cancel a contract or agreement that was entered into following an unsolicited offer to purchase the offeree's real property that was sent through the mail. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 13; Title 39; Title 47; Title 66 and Title 71.

1946.last_action: Failed in s/c Corrections Subcommittee of State Government Committee
1946.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 41, relative to pregnant incarcerated people.
1946.description: As introduced, requires correctional institutions to provide access to support people for certain pregnant prisoners or detainees during prenatal care and postpartum appointments, labor, and delivery. - Amends TCA Title 41.

1947.last_action: Assigned to s/c Higher Education Subcommittee
1947.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to technical education.
1947.description: As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to administer the Tennessee technical middle college program for high school students interested in receiving a high school diploma and a certificate from an eligible postsecondary institution upon graduation from high school; revises various requirements for dual enrollment grants to allow students participating in the program to receive a grant for each eligible postsecondary course attempted for purposes of the program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1948.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 6, Chapter 32, Part 1, relative to compensation for certain local officials in municipalities with general law modified manager-council charters.
1948.description: As enacted, authorizes the council of a municipality with a modified city manager-council charter to, upon the adoption of an ordinance by a 2/3 vote of the entire membership of the council, fix the salaries of the mayor and the members of the council annually at the time the operating budget is adopted. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 32, Part 1.

1950.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
1950.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 39, relative to dispossession of firearms.
1950.description: As introduced, requires a domestic assault offender who transferred possession of a firearm to a third party in order to dispossess the firearm to submit to the court an affidavit of firearms receipt in which the third party attests that the third party may lawfully possess a firearm, has received the firearm from the defendant, and accepts responsibility for possession of the firearm. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 39.

1951.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55 and Title 68, relative to ground ambulance service providers.
1951.description: As introduced, allows an individual who has reached 18 years of age, has a valid driver license, and has completed an emergency vehicle operations class to be eligible for service as an ambulance driver or operator. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 68.

1952.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
1952.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4, relative to controlled substances.
1952.description: As introduced, adds Tianeptine to the list of Schedule II controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

1953.last_action: Failed in s/c K-12 Subcommittee of Education Administration
1953.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to the reestablishment of the office of elected school superintendent.
1953.description: As introduced, allows counties and municipalities to reestablish the office of elected school superintendent. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1954.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 28, relative to property taxes.
1954.description: As enacted, authorizes a municipality to waive, compromise, remit, prorate, apportion, or release property taxes, penalty, interest, or court costs when the municipality purchases land at a delinquent tax sale for municipal taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 28.

1955.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, relative to ground ambulance service providers.
1955.description: As enacted, increases the number of EMT/AEMT training centers operated by ambulance services that may be operated from 15 to 30; authorizes EMT/AEMT training centers to provide online or virtual didactic instruction to the same extent such instruction may be provided by accredited EMS education institutions; makes other related changes; urges ambulance services operating EMT/AEMT training centers and the Tennessee board of regents to develop partnerships as practicable to increase the capacity of this state to prepare EMTs, AEMTs, and paramedics. - Amends TCA Title 68.

1956.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 38, relative to law enforcement body camera video.
1956.description: As enacted, extends the date for repeal of a current law specifying certain law enforcement body camera video must be treated as confidential and not subject to public inspection from July 1, 2022, until July 1, 2027; revises provision in regard to the confidentiality of body camera video that depicts minors within a school that serves grades K-12 to include as confidential such video that depicts minors in a child care agency, child care program, preschool, or nursery school. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 38.

1957.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 62, Chapter 13, relative to distance education courses for licensees.
1957.description: As enacted, removes the requirement that a distance education course using computer-based or online materials or formats be certified by certain certifying bodies in order to be approved by the Tennessee real estate commission as qualifying continuing education if the course is a synchronous course. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.

1958.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to career and technical opportunities.
1958.description: As enacted, requires, by the 2023-2024 school year, each state college of applied technology to establish partnerships with each LEA that is located in the county in which the main campus of the state college of applied technology is located to provide early postsecondary opportunities for students enrolled in a high school in the LEA; encourages the board of regents to expand the presence of state colleges of applied technology in each county within this state to provide greater early post-secondary opportunities for students enrolled in a high school in an LEA. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1959.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 14 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
1959.description: As enacted, removes TCA § 14-2-101, which prohibits COVID-19 vaccine mandates by governmental entities, schools, and local education agencies, and removes TCA § 14-1-101, which is the definitions to the Title 14 COVID-19 laws, from the application of the Title 14 termination date of July 1, 2023; effective July 1, 2023, deletes the 14-1-101 definitions except for those that relate to the prohibition on COVID-19 vaccine mandates for governmental entities. - Amends TCA Title 14 and Title 68.

1960.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3, Chapter 9 and Title 8, Chapter 27, relative to the council on pensions.
1960.description: As enacted, deletes references to insurance related to the former council on pensions and insurance. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 9 and Title 8, Chapter 27.

1961.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1961.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 30; Title 31 and Title 32, relative to estates.
1961.description: As introduced, increases from $1.00 to $5.00 the minimum fine that may be assessed against an executor or administrator of an estate who is convicted of neglecting or refusing to appear before the clerk of the probate court and settle the accounts. - Amends TCA Title 30; Title 31 and Title 32.

1962.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4, relative to the drug offender registry.
1962.description: As enacted, requires the Tennessee bureau of investigation to remove from the drug offender registry the name and other identifying information of persons upon receipt of notice of the death of such person; requires bureau officials to verify the person's death, by checking the social security death index, obtaining a copy of the offender's certificate of death, or obtaining court documentation, a law enforcement report, or any other credible documentation as determined by the bureau. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

1964.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 4 and Title 55, Chapter 8, relative to golf carts on certain public roadways within a retail and entertainment district.
1964.description: As enacted, authorizes the City of Clarksville to allow golf carts on certain public roads, if the roads are closed to motor vehicle traffic, within the boundaries of a certain retail and entertainment district upon the adoption of an ordinance by a two-thirds vote. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4 and Title 55, Chapter 8.

1965.last_action: Assigned to s/c Higher Education Subcommittee
1965.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to in-state tuition for family members of persons serving in the military.
1965.description: As introduced, requires public institutions of higher education to classify a student who is the spouse or dependent child of a service member as an in-state student for tuition purposes, regardless of the spouse's or dependent child's domicile or place of residence. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1966.last_action: Assigned to s/c Agriculture & Natural Resources Subcommittee
1966.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 44 and Title 56, relative to domesticated animals.
1966.description: As introduced, prohibits counties and municipalities from adopting, enacting, or enforcing a rule, regulation, resolution, or ordinance relating to a specific breed of domesticated animal. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 44 and Title 56.

1967.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee of Criminal Justice Committee
1967.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 29; Title 33; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 43; Title 45; Title 50; Title 53; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to the "Free All Cannabis for Tennesseans Act."
1967.description: As introduced, enacts the "Free All Cannabis for Tennesseans Act"; establishes a regulatory structure for the cultivation, processing, and retail sale of marijuana and marijuana products in this state to be administered by the department of agriculture. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29; Title 33; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 43; Title 45; Title 50; Title 53; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

1968.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1968.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 69, Chapter 9 and Title 70, relative to the wildlife resources agency.
1968.description: As introduced, requires proceeds from the sale of assets by the wildlife resources agency to be deposited in the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 69, Chapter 9 and Title 70.

1969.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 5-5-102; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 18; Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2; Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 5, relative to qualifications for office.
1969.description: As enacted, requires that a candidate for county legislative body, constable, trustee, register, assessor of property, school board, or chief administrative officer of the highway department be a qualified voter of the county and a resident of the county for one year; requires that a candidate for clerk of a general sessions, circuit, criminal, or other special court be a qualified voter of the county and resident of the county for one year prior to the date of the qualifying deadline for running as a candidate for the office. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-102; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 18; Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2; Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 5.

1970.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
1970.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 37; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to mothers.
1970.description: As introduced, establishes a grant program within the department to provide health care, child care support, workforce transition skills, and other benefits to new mothers. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

1971.last_action: Assigned to s/c Property & Planning Subcommittee
1971.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 13, relative to zoning.
1971.description: As introduced, requires that petitions to reclassify residential property to commercial property under local zoning regulations first be approved by households affected by the proposed reclassification. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 13.

1972.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
1972.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 71, relative to maternal health services.
1972.description: As introduced, requires TennCare to create and implement a three-year pilot program to provide remote patient monitoring services for maternal health to eligible TennCare recipients; authorizes the TennCare director to seek a federal waiver as necessary to implement the pilot program. - Amends TCA Title 71.

1973.last_action: Failed in s/c Children & Family Affairs Subcommittee of Civil Justice Committee
1973.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37, relative to the department of children's services.
1973.description: As introduced, requires the department to maintain staffing levels of case managers so that each region has enough case managers to allow caseloads not to exceed an average of 12 active cases relating to initial assessments, 12 children monitored and supervised in active cases relating to ongoing in-home services, or 13 children in active cases in which the children are in out-of-home placements relating to ongoing services. - Amends TCA Title 37.

1974.last_action: Received from House, Passed on First Consideration
1974.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 5 and Section 11-25-107, relative to the Doe Mountain Recreation Authority.
1974.description: As introduced, exempts the Doe Mountain Recreation Authority from the requirement to promulgate rules to establish and impose user fees to support the operation and maintenance of the Authority. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Section 11-25-107.

1975.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 140, relative to emergency medical services.
1975.description: As enacted, exempts a veteran of the United States armed forces who was trained and certified as a medic or corpsman from the initial licensure fees of the emergency medical services board. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 140.

1977.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Public Service Subcommittee of State Government Committee
1977.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3 and Title 4, relative to lobbying.
1977.description: As introduced, prohibits a state agency from lobbying for or against state legislation and prohibits the use of appropriated funds or funds under the agency's control for such purposes. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 4.

1978.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5, relative to certain fees collected by the secretary of state.
1978.description: As enacted, extends the period of reduced fees payable to the secretary of state relating to nonprofit charitable gaming and the solicitation of charitable funds. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.

1979.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1979.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 33; Title 49; Title 55; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to healthcare providers.
1979.description: As introduced, reduces from seven business days to five calendar days the period of time that begins upon a healthcare facility discovering that an incident of abuse, neglect, or misappropriation has occurred at a facility, within which the facility must report the incident to the department of health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 49; Title 55; Title 63 and Title 68.

1981.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 12; Section 49-6-2107 and Title 55, Chapter 50, relative to driver services.
1981.description: As introduced, enacts the "DMV Modernization Act of 2022"; requires department of safety to issue licenses to third-party service providers to perform certain driver services, such as the issuance of driver licenses. - Amends TCA Title 12; Section 49-6-2107 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

1982.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 4, relative to chiropractic physicians.
1982.description: As introduced, increases the number of regular meetings of the board of chiropractic examiners from one to two. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 4.

1983.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
1983.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 2, Part 1; Title 40, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 35, relative to restoration of rights.
1983.description: As introduced, requires any program that is a community-based alternative to incarceration to offer to all eligible persons participating in their program information on restoration of voting rights. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2, Part 1; Title 40, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

1986.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65 and Title 67, relative to utilities.
1986.description: As enacted, requires a utility system, upon request or application for a connection of utility service by a customer, to promptly provide the customer the connection cost. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65 and Title 67.

1987.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 11, relative to programs for nursing homes not participating in TennCare.
1987.description: As introduced, establishes a voluntary quality-based assessment grant program for nursing facilities not participating in TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

1988.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Commerce Committee
1988.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 54 and Title 67, relative to an interstate compact between the states of Arkansas, Mississippi, and Tennessee.
1988.description: As introduced, enacts the Interstate Compact Between the States of Arkansas, Mississippi, and Tennessee Creating the RegionSmart Development District and the RegionSmart Development Agency of the Greater Memphis Region. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 54 and Title 67.

1989.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1989.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68 and Title 69, relative to water and wastewater treatment authorities.
1989.description: As introduced, requires the independent certified public accountant firm that does an annual post audit of all books, accounts, and records of a water and wastewater treatment authority to issue the public audit report within five business days of the completion of the report. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.

1990.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Public Service Subcommittee of State Government Committee
1990.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 36, relative to mandatory retirement.
1990.description: As introduced, extends mandatory retirement provision imposed on certain public safety officers to commissioned special agents of the department of revenue and commissioned members of the department of environment and conservation; requires such persons to also receive, in addition to the retirement service allowance, a supplemental bridge allowance. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.

1991.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee
1991.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 5, relative to the compensation of administrators of elections.
1991.description: As introduced, increases the minimum compensation for certified administrators of elections from 90 percent of the compensation of the county assessor of property to 100 percent of the compensation of the county assessor of property. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 5.

1992.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 13; Title 13; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 68, relative to modular buildings.
1992.description: As introduced, directs the Tennessee advisory commission on intergovernmental relations to perform a study of laws in this state and other states related to the purchase of a modular building or the construction of a modular building, and to prepare a report comparing those laws and designating those laws providing the most consumer protection. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 13; Title 13; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 68.

1993.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40, relative to relocation of illegal aliens from this state.
1993.description: As introduced, requires commissioner, in collaboration with the commissioner of human services, to implement a system for the relocation of illegal aliens who arrive in this state to other locations. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

1994.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 21, relative to the certification of certain documents of the department of state.
1994.description: As enacted, removes requirement that certain statements submitted by nonprofit organizations when filing annual event applications, charitable solicitations applications, and athlete agent applications with the secretary of state be sworn under penalty of perjury; revises other related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 21.

1995.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
1995.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, Chapter 25, relative to electronic literary product licenses.
1995.description: As introduced, enacts the "Electronic Literary Product Act." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 25.

1996.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 3, relative to the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act.
1996.description: As enacted, removes requirement that an administrative judge or hearing officer make a motion prior to deciding a procedural question of law; removes similar requirement for such persons to direct parties or attorneys for parties to appear for a conference to consider matters relating to a contested case hearing; removes obsolete language regarding the manner in which parties may participate in hearings remotely and revises other related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 3.

1997.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
1997.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 8, relative to retired law enforcement officers.
1997.description: As introduced, increases from $5.00 to $6.00 the maximum fee that a sheriff may charge a retired law enforcement officer for taking the officer's fingerprints to run a background check on the officer for purposes of authorizing the officer to carry a firearm under federal law. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8.

1998.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 53 and Title 63, relative to prescriptions.
1998.description: As enacted, requires the board of pharmacy to promulgate rules necessary to ensure that an individual who is blind, visually impaired, or otherwise print disabled has appropriate access to prescription labels, bag tags, and medical guides. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 53 and Title 63.

1999.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3, relative to evaluations.
1999.description: As enacted, adds that if a teacher, for the current evaluation year, does not have access to individual growth data representative of student growth due to changes in academic standards or assessment design requiring standards validation or standards setting in the teacher's content or subject area, then 15 percent of the teacher's evaluation criteria must be comprised of student achievement data based on other measures of student achievement and 85 percent must be comprised of scores derived from the state board approved evaluation model for the qualitative portion of the teacher's evaluation unless using the current evaluation criteria results in a higher final evaluation score for the teacher. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.

2000.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Property & Planning Subcommittee of Local Government Committee
2000.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7, Chapter 4, relative to the use of a tax upon the privilege of occupancy allocated for the direct promotion of tourism.
2000.description: As introduced, requires that one-third of the proceeds derived from the tourist accommodation tax imposed by Davidson County be used for tourism promotion activities exclusively by and through a competitively bid contract of the metropolitan government to an entity whose primary purpose and activities are the direct promotion of tourism for the county. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 4.

2001.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55, relative to maintenance of certain public roads and bridges.
2001.description: As introduced, requires Davidson County to be responsible for the non-surface area maintenance, including mowing and litter removal, of medians, intersections, shoulders, and rights-of-way of public roads and bridges that are part of the state system of highways within the county. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55.

2002.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2002.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to educator performance.
2002.description: As introduced, requires the department of education to establish a grant program to award bonuses to public school teachers who achieve certain measures of performance. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2003.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
2003.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13, relative to firearms.
2003.description: As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor of knowingly giving, loaning, or transferring a firearm to another that the person knows or reasonably should know is prohibited by state or federal law from possessing a firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

2004.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 18, relative to temporary licenses.
2004.description: As enacted, allows the massage licensure board to issue a temporary license to certain persons from other states or U.S. territories; establishes requirements for persons granted such a temporary license. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 18.

2005.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Children & Family Affairs Subcommittee of Civil Justice Committee
2005.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39 and Title 40, relative to notifications.
2005.description: As introduced, requires the law enforcement agency responsible for enforcing an order of protection to provide a person who has obtained an order of protection issued pursuant to title 36, chapter 3, part 6, with information and a request form to receive notification of any arrest for a violation of the order of protection and subsequent release from custody of the individual against whom the order was entered; requires a jailer or sheriff to maintain a record of the person's request for notification and give immediate and prompt notice of such an arrest or release. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39 and Title 40.

2006.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
2006.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3; Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 16 and Title 68, relative to tires.
2006.description: As introduced, reduces, from the twenty-fifth day to the twentieth day of the month following the end of each quarter, the time in which a new tire dealer has to provide the commissioner information about the gross number of new tires sold at retail during the preceding quarter. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3; Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 16 and Title 68.

2007.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Insurance Subcommittee of Insurance Committee
2007.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55 and Title 56, relative to insurance for the use of a commercial motor vehicle.
2007.description: As introduced, requires each insurer that issues commercial motor vehicle insurance coverage to maintain a record of each commercial motor vehicle insurance policy in effect for vehicles registered in this state that was issued by the insurer. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 56.

2008.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 13, relative to aggravated assault.
2008.description: As enacted, requires that a person convicted of aggravated assault that involved the use or display of a deadly weapon be punished one classification higher than otherwise provided by law if the violation was committed by discharging a firearm from within a motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

2010.last_action: Failed in s/c Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee of Local Government Committee
2010.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 11 and Title 2, Chapter 12, relative to citizen appeals to the state election commission.
2010.description: As introduced, establishes a formal process by which a person may file a complaint with the state election commission alleging malfeasance or neglect of duty by a member of the state election commission or a county election commission. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11 and Title 2, Chapter 12.

2011.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2011.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-6-103, relative to distribution of revenues.
2011.description: As introduced, reduces, from 29.0141 percent to 28.5262 percent, the share of state sales and use tax revenue deposited to the state general fund; increases, from 4.6030 percent to 5.0909 percent, the share appropriated to municipalities. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.

2012.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 19; Title 20; Title 29; Title 39; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to property rights.
2012.description: As introduced, authorizes a law enforcement officer to charge a person with criminal trespass who resides with a person at least 65 years of age and makes a threat against the life, health, or safety of such person under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 19; Title 20; Title 29; Title 39; Title 68 and Title 71.

2013.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 14; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
2013.description: As introduced, extends, from 14 days to 15 days, the period of time within which a private business, governmental entity, school, or employer must notify the comptroller if the conditions or justifications no longer exist for the comptroller granting an exemption from compliance with certain COVID-19 provisions due to a loss of federal funding. - Amends TCA Title 14; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

2014.last_action: Rec. for pass. if am., ref. to Calendar & Rules Committee
2014.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to school attendance.
2014.description: As introduced, requires students who begin the ninth grade in a public or nonpublic high school in this state to attend public or nonpublic high school for four full school years unless the student is exempt from compulsory attendance, has successfully completed high school, or is enrolled and making satisfactory progress in a course leading to a GED® or HiSET®. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

2015.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Higher Education Subcommittee of Education Administration
2015.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8 and Title 49, Chapter 7, relative to tuition discounts.
2015.description: As introduced, extends a 25 percent discount on tuition to any state institution of higher education to every child under 24 years of age whose parent is employed as a school nurse in a public school in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49, Chapter 7.

2016.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
2016.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to minors.
2016.description: As introduced, increases from under 16 years of age to under 18 years of age, the age of a minor for whom a parent, guardian, legal custodian, or caregiver under the Power of Attorney for Care of a Minor Child Act must give written, active, informed and voluntarily signed consent in order for universal mental health or socioemotional screening in a school setting to be permitted for the minor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2017.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Corrections Subcommittee of State Government Committee
2017.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 41, Chapter 11, relative to reimbursement of imprisonment expenses.
2017.description: As introduced, entitles county jails to reimbursement of certain expenses incurred for detaining or housing state parolees waiting for parole revocation hearings. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 11.

2018.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 9, relative to the creation of a new campus of the University of Tennessee.
2018.description: As enacted, establishes the University of Tennessee Southern as a new campus of the University of Tennessee in Giles County. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 9.

2019.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Criminal Justice Committee
2019.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40, relative to bail.
2019.description: As introduced, requires a magistrate to set the defendant's bail in an amount not less than twice that which is customarily set for the offense charged if the alleged victim of the offense is a domestic violence victim and the defendant strangled, or attempted to strangle, the victim during the commission of the offense or made threats against the victim's life. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.

2020.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 37-1-408 and Title 49, relative to child abuse training programs.
2020.description: As enacted, clarifies that all employees working directly with students of an LEA or public charter school must complete an annual child abuse training program identified by the department of education or that meets the guidelines established by the department of children's services. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-408 and Title 49.

2021.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 36; Title 37 and Section 39-13-113, relative to the department of children's services.
2021.description: As enacted, requires department's case managers to report a suspected violation of a court order to law enforcement in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Section 39-13-113.

2022.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37 and Title 39, relative to child abuse.
2022.description: As enacted, requires a landlord or person in control of a residential rental property to provide a case manager from the department of children's services or a child protective investigation team with information on the address or location of a child who has been alleged to be abused or neglected and resides or is located on the residential rental property; grants immunity from liability for a cooperating landlord, except in cases of willful or wanton conduct or intentional wrongdoing. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 39.

2023.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37 and Title 39, relative to child protective investigations.
2023.description: As enacted, requires the department to convene a child protective investigation team when a report of severe child abuse is received; expands the role and procedures of a child protective team investigation to include cases involving severe child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 39.

2025.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Public Service Subcommittee of State Government Committee
2025.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8 and Title 36, relative to the department of children's services.
2025.description: As introduced, designates any employee of a service provider that contracts with the department of children's services to provide care or services for children as a state employee for the purposes of eligibility for enrollment in a basic health plan. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 36.

2026.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2026.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3, relative to ground ambulance service providers.
2026.description: As introduced, requires an annual training pay bonus supplement for eligible emergency medical services personnel in the amount of $800. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3.

2027.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to student discipline.
2027.description: As enacted, specifies that a discipline policy or code of conduct adopted by a local board of education or charter school governing body may authorize a teacher to withhold a student's phone from the student for the duration of the instructional time if the student's phone is a distraction to the class or student. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

2028.last_action: Assigned to s/c Banking & Consumer Affairs Subcommittee
2028.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 12 and Title 50, Chapter 2, relative to minimum wage.
2028.description: As introduced, authorizes a local government to require a private employer to pay an hourly wage in excess of the minimum hourly wage set by state or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 12 and Title 50, Chapter 2.

2029.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 3 and Title 67, Chapter 6, relative to taxation.
2029.description: As enacted, increases from 0.5344 percent to 0.88 percent the portion of the state gasoline tax apportioned for distribution to the wildlife resources fund; specifies that in addition to any other purposes authorized by law for which such funds may be used, the gas tax funds apportioned to the wildlife resources fund must also be used for public and environmental infrastructure at marinas. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

2030.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
2030.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 1; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 20; Title 27; Title 28; Title 29 and Title 49, relative to actions against the state.
2030.description: As introduced, establishes August 1 as the date by which the attorney general and reporter must provide a report to the state board of claims describing the manner in which funds received from the risk management fund were used during the immediately preceding fiscal year to defend actions brought against the state and its employees, rather than any time subsequent to the close of the respective fiscal year. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 20; Title 27; Title 28; Title 29 and Title 49.

2032.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 205, relative to the Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy and Resilience Act.
2032.description: As enacted, revises the threshold at which assessments and indebtedness, as a percentage of the fair market value of a subject property, affect the eligibility of the property to participate under the Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy and Resilience Act; adds property owned by certain kinds of organizations to the definition of "commercial property"; makes other changes related to the Act. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 205.

2033.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, relative to unlawful restraint of a dog.
2033.description: As introduced, creates the offense of unlawful restraint of a dog when an owner leaves a dog outside and unattended by use of a restraint without access to adequate shelter and potable water or restrains a dog outside and unattended by use of a prohibited restraint; classifies the offense as a Class C misdemeanor and a second or subsequent offense as a Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39.

2034.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Naming & Designating
2034.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 15, Chapter 2, relative to honoring Adolph Thornton.
2034.description: As introduced, designates November 17 as "Adolph Thornton Day of Service." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2.

2035.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Corrections Subcommittee of State Government Committee
2035.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 41; Title 56 and Title 71, relative to inmates.
2035.description: As introduced, prohibits a private or state or local governmental entity from charging an inmate a copayment, coinsurance, or similar charge for on-site medical care from a physician, dentist, or medical care provider. - Amends TCA Title 41; Title 56 and Title 71.

2036.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30 and Title 55, Chapter 50, relative to driver licenses for minors.
2036.description: As enacted, removes authority of the department of safety to deny a license to a minor for unsatisfactory academic progress; retains provisions for denial of a license, with certain exceptions, to a minor when the person is a student who is not enrolled in school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

2037.last_action: Assigned to s/c Elections & Campaign Finance Subcommittee
2037.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 35, Chapter 50, relative to political party nominees.
2037.description: As introduced, requires each political party to require each nominee of the political party for United States senator and member of the United States house of representatives to place the nominee's assets in a blind trust until the nominee loses the election or leaves office after being elected. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 35, Chapter 50.

2038.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2038.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 4 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2, relative to funding scholarships for certified municipal finance officers.
2038.description: As introduced, establishes a mechanism to fund scholarships for municipal financial officer candidates to receive certification and continuing education post-certification. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 4 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2.

2039.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39; Title 40; Title 55 and Title 69, relative to electronic monitoring.
2039.description: As enacted, imposes certain requirements on a contract service provider, which is a private entity that enters into a written contract or agreement with a government entity of this state to provide supervision, counseling, or collection services for offenders using an electronic monitoring device, excluding ignition interlock providers. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 55 and Title 69.

2041.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2041.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 6, relative to sales tax exemption for sales of precious-metals bullion.
2041.description: As introduced, exempts certain sales of gold, silver, platinum, and palladium bullion from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

2043.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 4, relative to temporary plates.
2043.description: As enacted, increases, from 30 days to 60 days, the initial period of time a temporary plate issued by a dealer is valid for a motor vehicle; increases the fee for such plate from $5.50 to $6.50. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

2044.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2044.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 55-4-256 and Section 55-4-257, relative to license plates for veterans with disabilities.
2044.description: As introduced, increases, from one to two, the number of free plates for the Purple Heart and disabled veteran license plates issued to veterans with disabilities. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-256 and Section 55-4-257.

2045.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 6, relative to child protective teams.
2045.description: As enacted, permits each child protective team to include one appropriately credentialed medical provider as a member of the team. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 6.

2046.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 48, Chapter 57, relative to meetings.
2046.description: As enacted, authorizes the members and proxyholders of nonprofit corporations to meet remotely under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 57.

2047.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 56 and Title 71, relative to medical equipment.
2047.description: As enacted, prohibits a health insurer from considering the location where complex rehabilitation technology will be used when making a medical necessity determination; requires health insurers to offer a prior authorization process for complex rehabilitation technology coverage determinations; imposes other related requirements governing coverage for complex rehabilitation technology. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.

2048.last_action: Assigned to s/c Departments & Agencies Subcommittee
2048.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 7-86-303, relative to emergency communications districts.
2048.description: As introduced, changes how the emergency communications board calculates the amount of funding each emergency communications district receives annually. - Amends TCA Section 7-86-303.

2049.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 12, relative to discrimination against Israel.
2049.description: As enacted, prohibits a public entity from entering into a contract with a company unless the contract includes a written certification that the company is not currently engaged in, and will not for the duration of the contract engage in, a boycott of Israel; provides exemptions for contracts with a total value of less than $250,000 and contractors with fewer than 10 employees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 12.

2050.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2050.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 71, relative to medicaid postpartum coverage.
2050.description: As introduced, extends from 60 days to 12 months the period of postpartum coverage for pregnant women who meet certain medical assistance eligibility requirements in accordance with provisions of the American Rescue Plan. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

2051.last_action: Assigned to s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee
2051.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 6, relative to sales tax exemptions.
2051.description: As introduced, exempts certain sales of gold, silver, platinum, and palladium coins and bullion from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

2052.last_action: Assigned to s/c Public Service Subcommittee
2052.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37 and Title 49, relative to reemployment after retirement.
2052.description: As introduced, expands the list of retired members of TCRS who may work more than 120 days while continuing to draw retirement allowance to include teachers and school bus drivers if a director of schools certifies that no other certified person is qualified and available for the position. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37 and Title 49.

2053.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, relative to vital records.
2053.description: As enacted, authorizes a medical examiner or attending or pronouncing physician in a hospital to file a death certificate; removes authority for a person acting as a funeral director who first assumes custody of the dead body to file a death certificate; removes requirement for an attending physician or medical examiner to give notice for delay in completing medical certification for the cause of death to a person acting as a funeral director. - Amends TCA Title 68.

2054.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Commerce Committee
2054.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 65, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 1, relative to the creation of the office of the public advocate.
2054.description: As introduced, transfers the consumer advocate division in the office of the attorney general and reporter to the Tennessee public utility commission; renames the division the office of the public advocate. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 65, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 1.

2055.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65; Title 66, Chapter 9, Part 2 and Title 68, relative to solar energy.
2055.description: As enacted, establishes certain requirements for solar power facility agreements. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65; Title 66, Chapter 9, Part 2 and Title 68.

2056.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to literacy.
2056.description: As enacted, requires the department of education to produce an annual report concerning the efficacy of training on reading instruction provided by educator preparation providers; authorizes the state board of education to place on probationary status or revoke the approval of an EPP or any other Tennessee educator issuing entity if the program fails to meet the standards established by the state board. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2057.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 15, relative to age-restricted products.
2057.description: As enacted, defines "smokeless nicotine product"; adds smokeless nicotine products to type of products that are age-restricted to persons aged 21 years and older under the Prevention of Youth Access to Tobacco, Smoking Hemp, and Vapor Products Act; specifies that nicotine replacement therapy products as defined and approved by the federal food and drug administration are not smokeless nicotine products. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 15.

2059.last_action: Assigned to s/c Criminal Justice Subcommittee
2059.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 70, relative to abuse of wildlife.
2059.description: As introduced, prohibits the torture and mistreatment of wild animals. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 70.

2060.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 10, relative to multicandidate political campaign committees.
2060.description: As enacted, requires that sworn complaints on a statement of a candidate for state public office or a statewide political campaign committee be filed in the office of the registry of election finance; requires that sworn complaints on a statement of a candidate for local public office or a local political campaign committee be filed in the office of the district attorney general who represents the judicial district in which the voter resides. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

2061.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 19 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 51, relative to suicide prevention.
2061.description: As enacted, enacts the "Save Tennessee Students Act," which requires LEAs that issue new student identification cards for students in grades 6-12 to include on the identification cards certain information regarding suicide prevention resources; requires an LEA to publish the telephone number for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline and the social media handle, telephone number, or text number for at least one additional crisis resource selected by the LEA in a conspicuous place in each school of the LEA that serves students in grades 6-12 or any combination thereof. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 19 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 51.

2062.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 3 and Title 30, Chapter 2, Part 2, relative to homestead exemptions.
2062.description: As enacted, increases the amount that must be held as homestead from the sale of real estate that is so situated that homestead cannot be set apart from $5,000 to $35,000. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 3 and Title 30, Chapter 2, Part 2.

2065.last_action: Assigned to s/c Agriculture & Natural Resources Subcommittee
2065.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 211, relative to waste.
2065.description: As introduced, increases from 15 to 30, the days in advance of a hearing concerning a proposed landfill approval that the county legislative body or the municipal governing body, or both, and the proposed landfill owner, must circulate notice of the hearing; increases from a three-mile radius to a 20-mile radius, the area in which the proposed landfill owner must provide notice by signs being erected on roads in that area leading directly to the proposed landfill site. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

2066.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 1 and Title 2, Chapter 13, relative to recognized minor parties.
2066.description: As introduced, reduces the percentage of votes required in a gubernatorial or county mayor election that a minor party candidate must receive for the minor party to remain a recognized minor party. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 1 and Title 2, Chapter 13.

2068.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2068.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 9; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48 and Title 67, relative to financial institutions.
2068.description: As introduced, authorizes licensed money transmitters to maintain their records electronically for the prescribed statutory period of three years. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 9; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48 and Title 67.

2069.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 36; Title 37 and Title 68, relative to children.
2069.description: As enacted, expands the definition of severe child sexual abuse for purposes of termination of parental rights and giving a parent standing to file a petition to terminate the parental rights of the abusive parent; declares all adoption records to be a public record when 100 years have elapsed since the date the adoption was finalized; makes various other changes in regard to termination of parental rights and adoption. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 36; Title 37 and Title 68.

2071.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Corrections Subcommittee of State Government Committee
2071.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41, relative to criminal justice.
2071.description: As introduced, requires that the Tennessee bureau of investigation's annual report on narcotics investigations be presented to the criminal justice committee of the house of representatives and the judiciary committee of the senate by March 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

2072.last_action: Failed in s/c Business & Utilities Subcommittee of Commerce Committee
2072.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 14; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
2072.description: As introduced, prohibits a place of entertainment that receives public funds of this state, or any political subdivision of this state, from compelling or taking an adverse action to compel a person to provide proof of vaccination for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 14; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68.

2074.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35 and Title 8, Chapter 36, relative to retirement for law enforcement officers.
2074.description: As introduced, for purposes of computing the number of years of creditable service in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system, requires that a member who is employed as a law enforcement officer receive an additional, automatic credit of one year of service for every four years of creditable service the member has earned. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35 and Title 8, Chapter 36.

2075.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 41, Chapter 51, relative to pay supplements for correctional officers.
2075.description: As introduced, creates a supplemental pay incentive program for correctional officers of the department who receive 40 hours or more of in-service training per calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 41, Chapter 51.

2076.last_action: Assigned to s/c Education Instruction Subcommittee
2076.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to assessments.
2076.description: As introduced, requires the department to contract for the development of assessments to be annually administered to students in grades nine and 10 in the subjects of English, math, reading, and science to replace certain end-of-course assessments administered as part of the Tennessee comprehensive assessment program; requires the department to develop proposed evaluation guidelines and criteria for educators teaching the grades and subjects for which the new assessments will be administered. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2078.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to the office of elected superintendent of schools.
2078.description: As introduced, enacts the "Local School District Empowerment Act," which creates a pilot program for the establishment of the office of elected superintendent of schools; requires the department of education to study the pilot program procedures for establishment of the office; adjusts duties of local boards of education in school systems in which the office of elected superintendent of schools is established. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2079.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
2079.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, relative to anatomical gifts.
2079.description: As introduced, requires a procurement organization or hospital contacting an individual following the death of the decedent for purposes of allowing the individual to make an anatomical gift to explain to the individual that the individual can designate the decedent's whole body or a part, and the process of making an anatomical gift and the condition the decedent's body will be in after the completion of the process. - Amends TCA Title 68.

2080.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Health Subcommittee of Health Committee
2080.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 50; Title 56; Title 63, Chapter 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, relative to medical records.
2080.description: As introduced, establishes standardized pricing for delivery of medical records electronically or on digital media. - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 56; Title 63, Chapter 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

2081.last_action: Failed in s/c Civil Justice Subcommittee of Civil Justice Committee
2081.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 16, Chapter 18, Part 3 and Title 40, relative to expunction.
2081.description: As introduced, expands a municipal court's jurisdiction to include expunction of a conviction for a violation of a municipal ordinance. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 18, Part 3 and Title 40.

2082.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to teacher training.
2082.description: As introduced, requires educator preparation providers approved by the state board of education to require each candidate enrolled in the provider's educator preparation program to successfully complete at least one course each semester on reading instruction in order for the provider to retain state board approval. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2085.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to attendance requirements.
2085.description: As enacted, broadens the category of nonresident employees, from only teachers to all LEA employees, whose children may attend a school within the LEA that employs the child's parent, including out of state employees of an LEA whose children attend the LEA, and who may be exempt from a tuition requirement, pursuant to board policy. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2087.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to training schools.
2087.description: As enacted, extends the authorization for state colleges and universities under the board of regents or a state university board to contract with a board of education to provide for the teaching of the children of public school age in the training school to allow such a contract with any county or city board of education instead of only the local board in the county or city in which the institution is located. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2088.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10, Chapter 7, relative to the Handle With Care Program.
2088.description: As enacted, exempts records generated as a result of a Handle With Care Program notification, which is an alert provided to a school system regarding a child's potential exposure to an adverse childhood experience, from the open records requirement through July 1, 2027. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

2089.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9, relative to financial aid.
2089.description: As introduced, adds William R. Moore College of Technology as an eligible institution for receipt of Tennessee reconnect grants and Wilder-Naifeh technical skills grants. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

2094.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
2094.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 49, relative to the board of regents.
2094.description: As introduced, changes, from five days to seven days, the amount of notice the secretary must give board members of called meetings. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49.

2095.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 71, relative to the food stamp program.
2095.description: As enacted, requires the department of human services to submit a report to the general assembly no later than October 31, 2022, and annually thereafter with certain information regarding the federal Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program; prohibits the department from providing an exemption from the work requirement, as provided under federal law, to able-bodied adults without dependents (ABAWDs) in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 71.

2096.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2096.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2, relative to the "Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organization (RICO) Act of 1989."
2096.description: As introduced, makes revisions to the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organization (RICO) Act of 1989, including expanding the definition of racketeering activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2.

2097.last_action: Taken off notice for cal in s/c Finance, Ways, and Means Subcommittee of Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
2097.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 13, relative to offenses committed against law enforcement officers.
2097.description: As introduced, increases the penalty for assault that results in the bodily injury of a law enforcement officer who is discharging the officer's official duties from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony; maintains the 30-day minimum sentence and $5,000 minimum fine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

2098.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
2098.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 29; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to health.
2098.description: As introduced, clarifies that the annual evaluation report to the general assembly on the adequacy of the department’s birth defects registry may be submitted by electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2099.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 45; Title 50; Title 56, Chapter 1 and Title 67, relative to employee-owned businesses.
2099.description: As introduced, enacts the "Employee Ownership, Empowerment, and Expansion Act," to support the growth and expansion of employee-owned businesses. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 45; Title 50; Title 56, Chapter 1 and Title 67.

2100.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2; Title 8, Chapter 8 and Title 41, relative to voting.
2100.description: As introduced, creates a polling place pilot program in Davidson County jails to provide eligible inmates the opportunity to vote; terminates the program on December 31, 2023. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 8, Chapter 8 and Title 41.

2102.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 62, relative to funeral directors and embalmers.
2102.description: As enacted, authorizes licensed funeral directors to sell pre-need funeral contracts and prearrangement insurance policies without registering with the commissioner of commerce and insurance; requires that continuing education completed virtually for renewal of embalmer and funeral director licenses involve continuous two-way transfer of information; defines unlicensed assistants for funeral establishment licensure laws. - Amends TCA Title 62.

2103.last_action: Failed in s/c Insurance Subcommittee of Insurance Committee
2103.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 71, Chapter 5, relative to medicaid expansion.
2103.description: As introduced, directs the governor to seek a new TennCare waiver within 180 days of the effective date of this act to provide medical assistance coverage for the same population groups and services as the Insure Tennessee proposal; clarifies that the amendment takes effect upon federal approval. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

2104.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 67, relative to a program to increase the availability of healthy food.
2104.description: As introduced, enacts the "Healthy Food Financing Act"; levies a $0.05 tax on beverage containers to fund the act. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 67.

2105.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 49-6-1006, relative to black history.
2105.description: As enacted, requires, rather than recommends, that the course of instruction for students in grades five through eight include curricula designed to educate students in black history and black culture. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-1006.

2106.last_action: Assigned to s/c Public Service Subcommittee
2106.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37, relative to early service retirement.
2106.description: As introduced, removes the requirement that the actuarial equivalent be paid to certain emergency medical services personnel, police officers, and firefighters who are eligible for early service retirement at 25 years of creditable service; requires that such persons who retire on or after January 1, 2023, be paid a full, unreduced retirement allowance and receive insurance coverage otherwise provided to members who are 100 percent vested in the service retirement benefit; requires such persons to also receive a supplemental bridge benefit. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.

2107.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to instructional materials.
2107.description: As enacted, requires that all math, science, and social studies textbooks and instructional materials be aligned to state academic standards by a certain date; prohibits the state board of education from granting waivers for textbooks or instructional materials, including those for English language arts, that are not aligned to state academic standards by that date. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

2108.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71, relative to doulas.
2108.description: As enacted, requires the department to collaborate with the bureau of TennCare in order to study existing doula certification programs; requires that a report on the study be provided to the members of the general assembly and to the legislative librarian by December 31, 2022. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71.

2109.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, relative to financial transactions.
2109.description: As enacted, enacts the "LIBOR Discontinuance and Replacement Act." - Amends TCA Title 47.

2111.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2; Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 8, Chapter 4, relative to the Verify Our Tennessee Elections Act.
2111.description: As introduced, requires the comptroller of the treasury to establish an office of election integrity within the department of audit to perform and supervise election audits. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 8, Chapter 4.

2112.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 33; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 71, relative to human trafficking.
