2876.description: As enacted, vacates and reconstitutes the membership of the Tennessee human rights commission effective September 1, 2022, and makes other changes concerning the commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Section 8-50-103 and Section 68-1-113.

2877.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
2877.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 11, relative to pregnancy.
2877.description: As introduced, increases, from three consecutive meetings to four consecutive meetings, the number of meetings a member of the council of certified professional midwifery may miss without excuse before being removed and replaced with a new member appointed by the commissioner of health. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

2878.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Insurance Committee
2878.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to insurance.
2878.description: As introduced, reduces from 30 to 15 days, the amount of time that an entity or individual licensed under the insurance laws of this state has to respond to a request by the department of commerce and insurance concerning a complaint filed against the entity or individual, unless another time period is provided in law. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71.

2879.last_action: P2C, caption bill, held on desk - pending amdt.
2879.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, relative to the Tennessee human rights commission.
2879.description: As introduced, shortens from one year to six months, the time period in which the commission is to report to the governor and the general assembly concerning the commission's activities relative to Title VI. - Amends TCA Title 4.

2880.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 307 of the Private Acts of 1982; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Gibson County Juvenile Judge.
2880.description: Subject to local approval, changes the office of juvenile court judge from a part-time to a full-time position. - Amends Chapter 307 of the Private Acts of 1982.

2881.title: AN ACT to make appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of the state government for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2021, and July 1, 2022, in the administration, operation and maintenance of the legislative, executive and judicial branches of the various departments, institutions, offices and agencies of the state; for certain state aid and obligations; for capital outlay, for the service of the public debt, for emergency and contingency; to repeal certain appropriations and any acts inconsistent herewith; to provide provisional continuing appropriations; and to establish certain provisions, limitations and restrictions under which appropriations may be obligated and expended. This act makes appropriations for the purposes described above for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2021, and July 1, 2022.
2881.description: As enacted, makes appropriations for the fiscal years beginning July 1, 2021, and July 1, 2022.

2885.title: AN ACT to authorize the state of Tennessee, acting by resolutions of its funding board, to issue and sell its bonds and bond anticipation notes to provide for acquisition of equipment and sites, and erection, construction, and equipment of sites and buildings, expressly including the acquisition of existing structures for expansion, improvements, betterments, and extraordinary repairs to existing structures, for construction of highways, and repair, replacement, or rehabilitation of bridges, and for grants to any county, metropolitan government, incorporated town, city, special district of the state, or any governmental agency or instrumentality of any of them; to make grants to industrial development corporations to provide for acquisition of equipment and acquisition, site preparation, erection, construction, and equipment of sites and buildings; and infrastructure improvements and development; and to provide for the expenditure of said funds; to issue its debt in excess of the authorized amount to fund discount and costs of issuance; and to provide for the expenditure of said funds. This act makes appropriations for an indefinite period of time for the purpose of allocating the proceeds of the bonds and notes authorized by this act. This act cancels the bonds authorized by Chapter 758, Public Acts of 2020.
2885.description: As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $583.5 million; cancels the bonds authorized by Chapter 758, Public Acts of 2020; allocates proceeds of $500 million of bonds to the department of finance and administration to provide funds for the purpose of making a grant to Nashville/Davidson County for the construction of a domed sports stadium.

2886.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 553 of the Acts of 1903; as amended by Chapter 395 of the Acts of 1905; Chapter 200 of the Private Acts of 1919; Chapter 460 of the Private Acts of 1931; Chapter 700 of the Private Acts of 1931; Chapter 71 of the Private Acts of 1977; Chapter 59 of the Private Acts of 1979; Chapter 76 of the Private Acts of 1997; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter for the city of Tullahoma.
2886.description: Subject to local approval, deletes limitation that actions by a city attorney to collect tax liens cannot include more than 25 defendants; authorizes a city attorney to follow certain statutory provisions regarding the recovery of delinquent property taxes. - Amends Chapter 553 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

2887.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 38 of the Private Acts of 1985; as amended by Chapter 191 of the Private Acts of 1986; Chapter 121 of the Private Acts of 2000; as amended by Chapter 1 of the Private Acts of 2003; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter for the City of Bradford.
2887.description: Subject to local approval, increases the term of mayor from two to four years; authorizes the board of mayor and aldermen to appoint a city administrator. - Amends Chapter 38 of the Private Acts of 1985; as amended.

2888.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 128 of the Private Acts of 1990; as amended by Chapter 126 of the Private Acts of 1994; Chapter 55 of the Private Acts of 2018 and Chapter 12 of the Private Acts of 2019; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of McKenzie.
2888.description: Subject to local approval, deletes provision establishing wards within the City of McKenzie and makes related changes; changes "Councilman" to "Councilperson" in various provisions. - Amends Chapter 128 of the Private Acts of 1990; as amended.

2889.title: AN ACT relative to an entertainment event fee for certain events held in Coffee County.
2889.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the legislative body of Coffee County to impose an entertainment event fee on the sale and distribution of tickets to events in the county with an expected attendance of 500 persons or more.

2890.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 105 of the Private Acts of 2004; as amended by Chapter 73 of the Private Acts of 2012; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Town of Scotts Hill.
2890.description: Subject to local approval, creates the position of general manager for the town; extends the terms of office for mayor and aldermen from two years to four years, beginning with the August 2022 election. - Amends Chapter 105 of the Private Acts of 2004; as amended.

2891.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 232 of the Private Acts of 1953; as amended by Chapter 157 of the Private Acts of 1957; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to compensation for Montgomery County General Sessions Court Judges.
2891.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the county legislative body to set salaries for general sessions judges to be compensated at an amount equal to the salaries set for chancery and circuit court judges; the legislative body is authorized to set such salaries by private act in accordance with state law. - Amends Chapter 232 of the Private Acts of 1953; as amended.

2892.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 30 of the Private Acts of 1953; as amended by Chapter 141 of the Private Acts of 1986; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to Sumner County.
2892.description: Subject to local approval, repeals the authority of the county to approve the creation and expansion of private cemeteries, with such authority to be exercised by the board of zoning appeals, the planning commission and in accordance with existing state law. - Amends Chapter 30 of the Private Acts of 1953; as amended.

2893.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 475 of the Private Acts of 1917; as amended by Chapter 122 of the Private Acts of 1983 and Chapter 235 of the Private Acts of 1992; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Hamilton County Board of Education.
2893.description: Subject to local approval, increases the membership of the Hamilton County board of education from nine members to 11 members. - Amends Chapter 475 of the Private Acts of 1917; as amended.

2894.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 104 of the Acts of 1903; as amended and rewritten by Chapter 76 of the Private Acts of 2005; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Newport.
2894.description: Subject to local approval, rewrites the civil service system for the city fire department. - Amends Chapter 104 of the Acts of 1903; as amended and rewritten.

2895.last_action: P2C, ref. to Local Government Committee
2895.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 36 of the Private Acts of 1961; as amended by Chapter 185 of the Private Acts of 1984; Chapter 66 of the Private Acts of 1993 and Chapter 156 of the Private Acts of 1996; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Lewisburg.
2895.description: Subject to local approval, grants the City of Lewisburg the power to make various changes regarding public utility systems, telecommunications systems, public infrastructure, and impose fees from new land developments by ordinance. - Amends Chapter 36 of the Private Acts of 1961; as amended.

2896.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 533 of the Private Acts of 1917; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to authorize and empower the McKenzie Special School District to issue up to $4,000,000 of school bonds and notes; to provide for the terms and payment of such bonds and notes; and to provide for the pledge, levy, and collection of taxes to pay debt service on said bonds and notes.
2896.description: Pursuant to the request of the McKenzie special school district, permits the district to issue bonds or notes in the amount of $4 million or less and to issue bond anticipation notes in an amount of $4 million or less. - Amends Chapter 533 of the Private Acts of 1917.

2897.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 167 of the Private Acts of 1994; as amended by Chapter 39 of the Private Acts of 2020; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the Town of Oakland.
2897.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the establishment of schools; authorizes the hiring of attorneys for specific legal needs; requires the town judge to be a licensed attorney; shifts the responsibility of submitting an annual budget to the board of mayor and alderman from the mayor to the town manager; changes the bond requirements for contracts. - Amends Chapter 167 of the Private Acts of 1994; as amended.

2898.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 201 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended and rewritten by Chapter 90 of the Private Acts of 1991; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Celina.
2898.description: Subject to local approval, increases compensation for aldermen, from $50 to $300, for each regularly scheduled meeting attended, not to exceed $600 per month; compensates aldermen $100 for each special meeting attended; increases in compensation would be effective beginning with the next terms of office. - Amends Chapter 201 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended and rewritten.

2899.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 84 of the Private Acts of 1991; as amended by Chapter 162 of the Private Acts of 1994; Chapter 141 of the Private Acts of 1996; Chapter 140 of the Private Acts of 1996; Chapter 132 of the Private Acts of 1998; Chapter 121 of the Private Acts of 1998; Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 2002; Chapter 64 of the Private Acts of 2005; Chapter 18 of the Private Acts of 2009 and Chapter 36 of the Private Acts of 2014; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Bristol.
2899.description: Subject to local approval, moves the election date for council from the third Tuesday in May to the first Tuesday in November; requires the budget and tax rate to be adopted by ordinance rather than resolution; authorizes the council to designate the location of its meetings by resolution; authorizes the recorder to levy a 5 percent penalty on delinquent taxes; changes gender specific terms for council members to gender neutral terms; makes other revisions to the charter. - Amends Chapter 84 of the Private Acts of 1991; as amended.

2900.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 174 of the Private Acts of 1925; as amended and rewritten by Chapter 33 of the Private Acts of 1973; Chapter 145 of the Private Acts of 1977; Chapter 302 of the Private Acts of 1980; Chapter 128 of the Private Acts of 1986; Chapter 160 of the Private Acts of 2000; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Dickson.
2900.description: Subject to local approval, changes the date of biennial city elections for mayor and councilmen from the last Thursday to the second Thursday in September; clarifies that ordinances and amendments to ordinances are to be made available for inspection by the public rather than read in full; specifies that the mayor must nominate a member from the council as vice mayor, to be approved by the council rather then having the council to elect such person directly; expands role of city recorder to include any other administrative position the mayor determines to be beneficial to the operation of the city. - Amends Chapter 174 of the Private Acts of 1925; as amended and rewritten.

2901.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 669 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended by Chapter 207 of the Private Acts of 1984; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the City of McEwen.
2901.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the mayor to appoint city officers, subject to confirmation by the city aldermen, in lieu of such officers being appointed by the board of mayor and aldermen; specifies the duties and authority of the city manager, once such officer to be appointed by the mayor; clarifies that the mayor shall have supervision and control of all administrative affairs of the city; establishes that the mayor may only suspend officers or other employees of the city if approved by the city aldermen rather then having the sole authority to take such action. - Amends Chapter 669 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended.

2902.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 429 of the Private Acts of 1931; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to creating and funding certain trusts and accounts.
2902.description: Subject to local approval, establishes the Community Investment Trust, the Park and Recreation Restricted Account, and the Transportation Restricted Account for purposes of funding certain community projects in the City of Murfreesboro. - Amends Chapter 429 of the Private Acts of 1931.

2904.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 330 of the Acts of 1901; as amended by Chapter 99 of the Private Acts of 1943; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to terms of the board of directors of the Tenth Special School District of Wilson County.
2904.description: Pursuant to the request of the Tenth Special School District of Wilson County, shortens the terms of the board of directors from six years to four years. - Amends Chapter 330 of the Acts of 1901; as amended.

2905.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 2006; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Town of Petersburg.
2905.description: Subject to local approval, reduces the number of aldermen from seven to five; reduces the number of readings required to pass an ordinance from three to two. - Amends Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 2006.

2906.title: AN ACT to create and establish an Authority for and on behalf of the County of Cumberland, the City of Crossville, and water utility districts in the region, to be known as the "Cumberland Plateau Water Authority," and to authorize all necessary powers in connection therewith.
2906.description: Subject to local approval, creates the Cumberland Plateau Water Authority.

2907.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 75 of the Private Acts of 2005; as amended by Chapter 112 of the Private Acts of 2006 and Chapter 67 of the Private Acts of 2016; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Munford.
2907.description: Subject to local approval, requires that newly elected officials take office after the certification of election results at the first meeting of the legislative body following an election rather than immediately after the election to allow for a more timely transition of officeholders. - Amends Chapter 75 of the Private Acts of 2005; as amended.

2908.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 313 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended by Chapter 38 of the Private Acts of 1987; Chapter 29 of the Private Acts of 2007; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to purchasing in Bradley County.
2908.description: Subject to local approval, sets the minimum contract amount required by competitive bidding for general fund, board of education, and road department purchases at $25,000 or more. - Amends Chapter 313 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended.

2909.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 57 of the Private Acts of 2016; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the charter of the City of Rocky Top.
2909.description: Subject to local approval, adds a one-year residency requirement to be eligible to run for the offices of mayor and city councilperson. - Amends Chapter 57 of the Private Acts of 2016.

2910.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 118 of the Private Acts of 2002; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Polk County Board of Education.
2910.description: Subject to local approval, increases number of persons serving on the board of education from nine to 10 members. - Amends Chapter 118 of the Private Acts of 2002.

2911.title: AN ACT to establish the Rutherford County Board of Juvenile Detention Center Commissioners to oversee and supervise the Rutherford County Juvenile Detention Center.
2911.description: Subject to local approval, creates the Rutherford County Board of Juvenile Detention Center Commissioners.

2912.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 304 of the Private Acts of 1982; as amended by Chapter 74 of the Private Acts of 2008; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Hawkins County Juvenile Court.
2912.description: Subject to local approval, sets the compensation for the juvenile court judge to equal the compensation of the Hawkins County general sessions judge; requires the juvenile court judge to serve in that capacity full time; prohibits the juvenile court judge from otherwise practicing law. - Amends Chapter 304 of the Private Acts of 1982; as amended.

2913.title: AN ACT to establish the office of county attorney for Washington County.
2913.description: Subject to local approval, establishes the office of county attorney.

2914.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 297 of the Private Acts of 1976; as amended by Chapter 125 of the Private Acts of 1977; Chapter 80 of the Private Acts of 1985; Chapter 99 of the Private Acts of 1985; Chapter 71 of the Private Acts of 2012; Chapter 72 of the Private Acts of 2014; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the Chattanooga-Hamilton County Hospital Authority.
2914.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the sale, lease, or other transfer of the Chattanooga-Hamilton County Hospital Authority's assets or liabilities. - Amends amend Chapter 297 of the Private Acts of 1976; as amended.

2915.last_action: Def. to Summer Study in Finance Tax of Extraordinary Session
2915.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9; Title 38; Title 45, Chapter 7; Title 49 and Title 67, relative to funding salary increases for teachers and other educational staff.
2915.description: As introduced, imposes fees on certain money transmissions originating in this state to a location outside of the United States or its territories; requires that funds generated from collection of fees be used to fund salary increases for teachers and other educational staff. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 38; Title 45, Chapter 7; Title 49 and Title 67.

2916.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to literacy.
2916.description: As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Literacy Success Act"; requires LEAs to provide foundational literacy skills instruction, provide reading interventions and supports, and administer universal reading screeners to students in kindergarten through grade three to improve reading proficiency. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

2917.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6; Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1, relative to accountability.
2917.description: As enacted, excludes data generated by state assessments administered in the 2020-2021 school year, and data generated by alternative growth models used by LEAs in the 2020-2021 school year to evaluate teachers in non-tested grades and subjects, from certain accountability determinations; revises certain tenure eligibility requirements to account for the unavailability of data due to the cancellation of TCAP tests as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6; Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1.

2918.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to the Tennessee Learning Loss Remediation and Student Acceleration Act.
2918.description: As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Learning Loss Remediation and Student Acceleration Act"; requires local education agencies and public charter schools to implement a program of after-school learning mini-camps, learning loss bridge camps, and summer learning camps to remediate student learning loss. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

2933.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29, Chapter 34; Title 49; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19 exposure.
2933.description: As introduced, authorizes a local board of education or charter school governing body to adopt policies and procedures relative to COVID-19 quarantining; requires a claimant alleging loss, damage, injury, or death caused by or resulting from a policy adopted by a local board or charter school governing body to prove by clear and convincing evidence that the board or governing body caused the injury by an act or omission constituting gross negligence or willful misconduct. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34; Title 49; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68.

2935.last_action: P2C, ref. to Education 12 of Extraordinary Session
2935.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to in-person student attendance to remediate learning loss sustained as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.
2935.description: As introduced, requires LEAs serving any of the grades K-8 to provide in-person instruction for students for a minimum of 70 days in the 2020-2021 school year by June 30, 2021, and the full 180 days in the 2021-2022 school year; the commissioner of education may withhold all or part of an LEAs BEP funding, if the LEA fails to comply with the in-person instruction requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2936.last_action: P2C, ref. to Education 345 of Extraordinary Session
2936.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to increases in funding during the 2020-2021 and 2021-2022 fiscal years for teacher pay raises.
2936.description: As introduced, requires the state, subject to appropriation, to increase state funding to the LEAs in the BEP instructional salaries and wages category in the 2020-2021 fiscal year and in the 2021-2022 fiscal year in the amounts identified in the general appropriations act of the first extraordinary session of the 112th General Assembly; requires LEAs to provide base salary increases for classroom teachers using the increase in funding. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2937.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to the 2020-2021 school year.
2937.description: As introduced, authorizes an LEA to close school in the 2020-2021 school year if the LEA determines it is in the best interest of the LEA's teachers, students, and staff to protect them from COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2938.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 4-29-243; Section 4-29-244; Section 10-7-504; Title 64; Section 67-5-502 and Section 67-5-505, relative to the Megasite Authority of West Tennessee Act of 2021.
2938.description: As enacted, creates the Megasite Authority of West Tennessee. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-243; Section 4-29-244; Section 10-7-504; Title 64; Section 67-5-502 and Section 67-5-505.

2939.title: AN ACT to make appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of the state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2021, in the administration, operation and maintenance of the legislative, executive and judicial branches of the various departments, institutions, offices and agencies of the state; for certain state aid and obligations; for capital outlay, for the service of the public debt, for emergency and contingency; to repeal certain appropriations and any acts inconsistent herewith; to provide provisional continuing appropriations; and to establish certain provisions, limitations, and restrictions under which appropriations may be obligated and expended. This act makes appropriations for the purposes described above for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2021.
2939.description: As enacted, makes appropriations sufficient to provide the first year's funding for any act which receives final passage during the second extraordinary session of the 112th General Assembly.

2940.last_action: Rec. for pass. if am., ref. to Finance, Ways, and Means Committee of Extraordinary Session II
2940.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 14; Title 50; Title 64; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 5 and Title 68, relative to benefitting a new authority anticipated to be created through the governor's call to convene the 2nd Extraordinary Session of the One Hundred and Twelfth General Assembly on October 18, 2021.
2940.description: As introduced, clarifies that a claimant who chooses to leave employment because the employer required its employees to receive immunization or vaccination is not disqualified from receiving unemployment benefits based on that choice; specifies that benefits will not be reduced or denied for separation from employment caused by refusal to receive an immunization or vaccination. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 14; Title 50; Title 64; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 5 and Title 68.

2941.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2941.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9, Chapter 8, Part 3; Title 29, Chapter 34; Title 29, Chapter 20; Title 49 and Title 50, Chapter 6, relative to civil liability related to COVID-19.
2941.description: As introduced, applies liability for side effects of a COVID-19 vaccination to an employer or private institution of higher education that requires the vaccination for employment or enrollment; amends the Tennessee COVID-19 Recovery Act's definition of "arising from COVID-19" to exclude vaccinations for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8, Part 3; Title 29, Chapter 34; Title 29, Chapter 20; Title 49 and Title 50, Chapter 6.

2942.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2 and Title 49, Chapter 2, relative to local boards of education.
2942.description: As introduced, permits an election for school board members to be conducted on a partisan basis; permits a person seeking a position on a school board to campaign as the nominee or representative of a political party. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

2943.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2943.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 50 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
2943.description: As introduced, prohibits public employers from mandating COVID-19 vaccines as a condition of employment; requires private employers to document certain information regarding COVID-19 vaccine mandates for employees; imputes strict liability against private employers who mandate COVID-19 vaccines for employees if an employee has a severe adverse reaction or develops a severe health condition as the result of being vaccinated. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 50 and Title 68.

2944.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2944.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 14; Section 29-34-802; Title 50; Title 58 and Title 68, Chapter 5, relative to COVID-19.
2944.description: As introduced, revises and adds to provisions governing the conduct of public officials and entities in regard to COVID-19; transfers the existing provisions of law to a newly created title in TCA; prohibits other persons and businesses from compelling proof of vaccination from certain persons; specifies that the provisions of the newly created title will prevail over any conflicting law; creates cause of action. - Amends TCA Title 14; Section 29-34-802; Title 50; Title 58 and Title 68, Chapter 5.

2945.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2945.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to uniform standards for persons subject to COVID-19 face covering requirements in schools.
2945.description: As introduced, establishes uniform standards for persons subject to COVID-19 face covering requirements in schools by prohibiting a local board of education or public school from requiring students to wear a mask and by establishing a process through which a person may seek a reasonable accommodation if the person desires to be placed in an educational setting in which all persons who may come within six feet of another within that educational setting are wearing a mask. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2946.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2946.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to COVID-19.
2946.description: As introduced, prohibits discrimination based on a person's COVID-19 vaccination status or whether the person has a COVID-19 immunity passport; prohibits a person from being required to receive a COVID-19 vaccine that is allowed under emergency use authorization or that is undergoing safety trials. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2947.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2947.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 37; Title 49; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to establishing uniform standards for contact tracing of COVID-19.
2947.description: As introduced, prohibits LEAs, charter schools, and public institutions of higher education from developing and implementing contact tracing procedures for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 37; Title 49; Title 68 and Title 71.

2948.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Public Health Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2948.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 58; Title 68, Chapter 2 and Chapter 550 of the Public Acts of 2021, relative to local health authorities.
2948.description: As introduced, changes the appointing authority for county health officers and county health directors from the commissioner of health to the county mayor; requires the commissioner to concur in the mayor's appointment; requires county health departments to comply with the direction and rules of the commissioner of health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 58; Title 68, Chapter 2 and Chapter 550 of the Public Acts of 2021.

2949.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2949.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9, Chapter 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51, relative to entities that receive state grant funds that implement COVID-19 restrictions.
2949.description: As introduced, prohibits state funds from being appropriated or disbursed to or expended by a public or private entity that implements a COVID-19 vaccination or mask-wearing requirement as a condition of entry; requires the department of finance and administration to recoup state funds previously appropriated or disbursed to a public or private entity that has implemented such a requirement. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9, Chapter 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

2950.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2950.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to COVID-19 immunization of K-12 students.
2950.description: As introduced, prohibits K-12 schools that receive state funds from requiring students to be immunized against COVID-19 and from segregating students based on their COVID-19 immunization status. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2951.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2951.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21 and Title 68, relative to uniform standards regarding COVID-19 vaccinations.
2951.description: As introduced, creates a private cause of action for any person who suffers an adverse action by another due to the person's religious objection to receiving the COVID-19 vaccine. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21 and Title 68.

2952.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2952.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 29 and Title 68, relative to religious exemptions.
2952.description: As introduced, requires a person or entity that requires COVID-19 vaccination or proof of COVID-19 vaccination except in cases of religious exemption to include in the religious exemption any person who is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachers of such sect or division by reason of which the person is conscientiously opposed to receiving a COVID-19 vaccination. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29 and Title 68.

2953.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2953.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to addressing authorization to administer a COVID-19 vaccine to a minor without parental consent.
2953.description: As introduced, prohibits a healthcare practitioner from providing a minor patient an immunization, vaccination, or injection for the SARS-CoV-2 virus or a variant of the SARS-CoV-2 virus without consent from the minor's legal guardians; requires licensing boards to report violations and promulgate emergency rules to effectuate this bill. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2954.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Public Health Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2954.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 2, Part 6, relative to the authority of local governments to establish health policies during a health emergency.
2954.description: As introduced, specifies that the county mayor, in unincorporated areas, and the highest-ranking elected official in a city in the official's jurisdiction, have the exclusive authority to establish and implement health policies that affect the county or city, as applicable, during a health emergency; directs the county health director, health officer, and board of health to provide advice to the mayor and city official to develop the policies; applies to Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 2, Part 6.

2955.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2955.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to uniform standards for face covering requirements in schools due to COVID-19.
2955.description: As introduced, establishes uniform standards for face covering requirements in schools due to COVID-19 by authorizing a local board of education or public charter school governing body to revise its dress code or code of conduct to establish that wearing a face covering is an appropriate form of dress for students, teachers, and staff. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2956.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29 and Title 50, relative to COVID-19 mask requirements.
2956.description: As introduced, authorizes private employers to adopt dress codes for employment and service that require employees and persons on the employer's business premises to wear a mask to protect against COVID-19; provides immunity to private employers who implement and reasonably enforce such dress codes. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 50.

2957.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Title 50, relative to vaccinations.
2957.description: As introduced, prohibits the state from awarding a state contract, providing a tax incentive, or making a grant of funds to an employer in this state if the employer requires its employees to receive a COVID-19 vaccination; excludes from the prohibition the award of a state contract if the contractor is a single source of supply for a good or service or the contractor provides a proprietary good or service. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

2958.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Judiciary Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2958.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 16 and Title 17, relative to criminal offenses.
2958.description: As introduced, requires the court to appoint a district attorney general pro tem for the purpose of prosecuting a particular offense when a district attorney general publicly states that any person accused of committing such an offense will not be prosecuted by the district attorney general under any circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16 and Title 17.

2959.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2959.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 33; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to enacting the Tennessee Religious Objection to COVID-19 Treatment Act.
2959.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Religious Objection to COVID-19 Treatment Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2960.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 33; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to enacting the Tennessee COVID-19 Treatment Freedom Act.
2960.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee COVID-19 Treatment Freedom Act"; prohibits the board of medical examiners and board of osteopathic examination from disciplining a licensed physician relating solely to the physician's prescription, recommendation, use, or opinion relative to a treatment for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 33; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

2961.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2961.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to uniform standards relating to COVID-19.
2961.description: As introduced, prohibits discrimination based on COVID-19 vaccination status or whether an individual has an immunity passport. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2962.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2962.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 50, relative to an employee's receipt of unemployment benefits relative to COVID-19.
2962.description: As introduced, authorizes unemployment compensation to individuals who leave their most recent work due to a refusal to receive an employer-mandated COVID-19 vaccine; redefines "misconduct" to exclude a refusal of an employer-mandated COVID-19 vaccine; redefines "unemployed" to include an individual placed on unpaid leave for refusal to receive an employer-mandated COVID-19 vaccine. - Amends TCA Title 50.

2963.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 50, Chapter 6; Title 53, Chapter 1 and Title 68, relative to the COVID-19 Health Care Liberty Jurisdiction Act.
2963.description: As introduced, enacts the "COVID-19 Health Care Liberty Jurisdiction Act." - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 50, Chapter 6; Title 53, Chapter 1 and Title 68.

2964.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2964.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37; Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to medical treatment of minors.
2964.description: As introduced, prohibits a healthcare practitioner from providing an unemancipated minor patient with an immunization, vaccination, or injection for the SARS-CoV-2 virus or a variant of the SARS-CoV-2 virus without the consent of the minor's legal guardian; violations will be subject to professional discipline by licensing boards. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68.

2965.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to establishing uniform standards regarding restrictions relative to COVID-19.
2965.description: As introduced, enacts the "No Patient Left Alone Act." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2967.last_action: P2C, ref. to Public Health Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2967.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 58 and Title 68, relative to public health.
2967.description: As introduced, authorizes county mayor to designate a person for purposes of attending a county board of health meeting; during a declared state or local state of emergency, prohibits local health official enforcing a state or local public health order or directive against a business from bringing a law enforcement officer to the business unless the local health official articulates to the officer's employing law enforcement agency that the official will be under an imminent threat of bodily harm or death while enforcing the order or that the officer is needed to make an arrest; authorizes a business owner to file a complaint for violations regarding accompanying law enforcement officers. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 58 and Title 68.

2968.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2968.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
2968.description: As introduced, prohibits a licensing board or disciplinary subcommittee from taking any adverse action against a physician's license based solely on the physician's recommendation for treatment of COVID-19 if the physician exercised independent medical judgment and the patient provided written, informed consent; prohibits a pharmacy from blocking a patient's access to the medical treatment based solely on the fact that the United States Food and Drug Administration has not approved the medical treatment for use to treat COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

2969.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Finance, Ways, and Means Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2969.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 8 and Title 58, Chapter 2, relative to emergency powers.
2969.description: As introduced, reduces the time period, from 60 days to 21 days, that the governor can declare a state of emergency; requires the general assembly to authorize an extension of the state of emergency by joint resolution; prohibits the governor from shutting businesses down, restricting the freedom of travel and assembly of citizens, or expending funds without approval of such actions by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 8 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

2970.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2970.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to a uniform standard for COVID-19 sick leave.
2970.description: As introduced, authorizes up to 10 days of paid COVID-19 sick leave to full-time and part-time public school employees; requires the department of education to amend their federal plan to include COVID-19 paid sick leave for early childhood program employees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2971.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 29; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to establishing uniform standards for COVID-19.
2971.description: As introduced, prohibits a hospital or other licensed facility from restricting a pregnant patient from having a doula present with the patient during the stay in the hospital or facility as long as the doula tests negative for COVID-19 and is not exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19 or another virus or communicable disease. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2972.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2972.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 49; Title 50; Title 58; Title 62; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to infectious disease.
2972.description: As introduced, mandates that a person or public or private entity that requires a person to wear a mask or receive a vaccination for the purpose of preventing the SARS-CoV-2 virus in order to enter the person or entity's property to allow any person to opt out of the requirement based on personal preference; limits the powers and duties of the county health officer and county health director relative to masking or vaccination requirements for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 49; Title 50; Title 58; Title 62; Title 68 and Title 71.

2973.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2973.title: AN ACT to amend Title 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6, relative to injuries caused by vaccination.
2973.description: As introduced, creates a private right of action for an employee who suffers injury as a result of receiving a COVID-19 vaccination if the employee receives the vaccination because of an employment requirement established by the employer; allows the court to award damages including medical expenses, lost wages, and reasonable attorney's fees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2974.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2974.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to a private school's authority.
2974.description: As introduced, specifies that private schools have the sole authority to require people on the school's property to wear masks due to COVID-19 and to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2975.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to COVID-19.
2975.description: As introduced, enacts the "Freedom in Medical Treatment Act"; prohibits licensing boards from taking adverse action against a healthcare professional licensed by the board relating solely to the healthcare professional's prescription, recommendation, use, or opinion relative to a treatment for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2976.title: AN ACT amend Tennessee Code Annotated, relative to COVID-19 requirements.
2976.description: As introduced, prohibits a publicly traded corporation that operates in this state from requiring customers to provide any documentation certifying COVID-19 vaccination or post-infection recovery to gain access to, entry upon, or service from the corporation’s operations in this state; exempts hospitals and other health facilities; requires the department of commerce and insurance to impose a $5,000 civil penalty for a violation. - Amends amend TCA.

2977.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 29; Title 33; Title 34; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to establishing uniform standards regarding restrictions relative to COVID-19.
2977.description: As introduced, enacts the "COVID-19 Patients' Rights Act." - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 29; Title 33; Title 34; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

2978.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2978.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21, relative to vaccinations.
2978.description: As introduced, prohibits discrimination based on COVID-19 vaccination status. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21.

2979.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2979.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to restrictions regarding COVID-19.
2979.description: As introduced, prohibits requirements for receiving a medical intervention for COVID-19 or wearing a mask. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

2980.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2980.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29 and Title 39, relative to mask requirements.
2980.description: As introduced, creates the offense of requiring another to wear a mask for the purpose of preventing the spread of COVID-19 as condition of employment or in order to enter any building, facility, or property that is generally open to the public. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39.

2981.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2981.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29; Title 39 and Title 58, relative to COVID-19 vaccination.
2981.description: As introduced, creates an offense of requiring another to receive a COVID-19 vaccination or provide proof that the person has received a COVID-19 vaccination as condition of employment or in order to enter any building, facility, or property that is generally open to the public. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 39 and Title 58.

2982.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2982.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 49; Title 50, Chapter 1; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, relative to essential workers.
2982.description: As introduced, prohibits mandating mask, vaccine, or prophylactic measures on essential workers. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 49; Title 50, Chapter 1; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68.

2983.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2983.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29 and Title 39, relative to disclosure of COVID-19 vaccination status.
2983.description: As introduced, creates the offense of intentionally requiring that another disclose whether the person has received a COVID-19 vaccination, with knowledge that the person objects to disclosing the information, as a condition of employment or in order to enter any building, facility, or property that is generally open to the public; provides an exception to the offense for a healthcare provider who is providing treatment to the person. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39.

2984.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2984.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 58 and Title 68, relative to uniform standards for persons subject to COVID-19 face covering requirements.
2984.description: As introduced, prohibits the governor, an agency, a political subdivision, or a state-funded organization from mandating or coercing an applicant for employment, employee, or other person to wear a face covering that has not been prescribed by a licensed physician; includes exceptions for safety equipment, military gear, and penal institutions. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 58 and Title 68.

2985.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2985.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 50; Title 58; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to uniform standards for COVID-19.
2985.description: As introduced, exempts any person who has previously been infected with COVID-19 from any public or private COVID-19 mandate; provides for a cause of action for any person unable to obtain an exemption after providing proof of prior COVID-19 infection. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 50; Title 58; Title 63 and Title 68.

2986.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 49 and Title 68, relative to the Stop Medical and Employer Required Tyranny Act.
2986.description: As introduced, enacts the "Stop Medical and Employer Required Tyranny Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 49 and Title 68.

2987.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2987.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 68, relative to uniform standards for COVID-19.
2987.description: As introduced, prohibits certain healthcare practitioners from providing medical treatment for COVID-19 to a minor without parental consent or an appropriate court order. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 68.

2988.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2988.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29; Title 50, Chapter 1 and Title 50, Chapter 6, relative to liability related to COVID-19 vaccination.
2988.description: As introduced, establishes circumstances under which an employer is liable for injuries sustained by an employee as a result of the employer's vaccination or immunization mandate as a condition of employment. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 50, Chapter 1 and Title 50, Chapter 6.

2989.last_action: P2C, ref. to Public Health Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2989.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 68, Chapter 2, Part 6 and Chapter 550 of the Public Acts of 2021, relative to local health.
2989.description: As introduced, clarifies that a county health officer's quarantine requirements must be in accordance with the department's guidelines and state law; requires the commissioner to review and approve or disapprove a county health officer's plans that are issued pursuant to the necessity to protect the general health and safety of the county. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 68, Chapter 2, Part 6 and Chapter 550 of the Public Acts of 2021.

2990.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2990.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 50, Chapter 1, relative to COVID-19.
2990.description: As introduced, specifies that an employee can satisfy an employer's COVID-19 vaccination mandate by providing documentation of a complete immunization to COVID-19 or alternative documentation showing the presence of antibodies or proof of a past COVID-19 infection; establishes a cause of action against an employer that takes adverse action against an employee attempting to provide such documentation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1.

2991.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2991.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 4, relative to unpaid leave.
2991.description: As introduced, clarifies that the term "discharge" includes placing an employee on involuntary unpaid leave or unpaid leave of absence without expectation of return; specifies that placing an employee on involuntary unpaid leave or an unpaid leave of absence is not a reasonable accommodation to an employee's request for an exemption from a requirement to obtain vaccination or immunization from COVID-19 for religious or medical reasons. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 4.

2993.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Finance, Ways, and Means Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2993.title: AN ACT relative to the department of labor and workforce development's rule regarding the enforcement of the federal occupational safety and health administration's COVID-19 requirement.
2993.description: As introduced, schedules a rule filed by the department of labor and workforce development regarding the occupational safety and health standards COVID-19 emergency temporary rule to expire on the effective date of this act.

2994.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2994.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 2, relative to establishing a uniform standard regarding COVID-19 exposure.
2994.description: As introduced, establishes a uniform standard regarding quarantining and testing for COVID-19 for students, teachers, or personnel in public schools who are exposed to a person who tests positive for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 2.

2995.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2995.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3, relative to adverse actions against employees due to COVID-19 vaccination status.
2995.description: As introduced, expands the offense of civil rights intimidation to create a Class D felony, punishable by a fine not to exceed $5,000, for taking adverse action against an employee who has expressly objected to the COVID-19 vaccination based upon the employee's religious beliefs, creed, or conscience, with the intent to unlawfully intimidate or force the employee to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3.

2997.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
2997.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29; Title 34; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to right to try.
2997.description: As introduced, clarifies that treatments for COVID-19 are investigational drugs, biological products, or devices for purposes of the Phil Timp-Amanda Wilcox Right to Try Act. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 34; Title 63 and Title 68.

2998.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49, relative to adverse actions taken by the state against local education agencies that implement COVID-19 protocols.
2998.description: As introduced, prohibits the state from withholding or reducing state funding to an LEA due to the LEA implementing COVID-19 health and safety protocols. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49.

3000.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3000.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68, relative to employment.
3000.description: As introduced, authorizes employees of public and private employers to refuse a requirement by the employer that the employee receive a vaccine for COVID-19 as a condition of employment based on the employee's strongly held religious beliefs or right of conscience; requires an employee to provide the employer with written notice of the employee's refusal based on such grounds; creates right of action against an employer by employee against whom an adverse action was taken for refusing the vaccine. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

3001.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3001.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, relative to establishing uniform standards regarding vaccinations for COVID-19.
3001.description: As introduced, prohibits discrimination by an entertainment venue against an individual based on the individual's vaccination status, whether the individual has a vaccine passport, or whether the individual has a document showing proof of a negative test for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68.

3002.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3002.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to discrimination involving COVID-19.
3002.description: As introduced, makes it a discriminatory practice under the Tennessee Human Rights Act to discriminate in provision of a public accommodation based on a person's COVID-19 immunity status; makes violations subject to present statutory remedies including administrative action and civil litigation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

3003.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3003.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 29; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
3003.description: As introduced, prohibits a private employer from requiring an individual to be subjected to a COVID-19 vaccination if the individual has contracted and recovered from it; holds a private employer liable for certain costs if the employer requires an individual to be subjected to a COVID-19 vaccination and if the individual suffers serious bodily injury or death as a result. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 29; Title 50; Title 56 and Title 68.

3004.last_action: Taken off notice for cal. in Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3004.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to restrictions regarding COVID-19.
3004.description: As introduced, states that an individual may claim an exemption from a COVID-19 vaccination requirement based on acquired immunity through post-transmission recovery, a medical condition, or reasons of conscience; permits an employee whose employer does not accept such exemptions to file a complaint for a discriminatory employment practice. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

3005.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49, relative to LEA authority to establish uniform COVID-19 health and safety protocols.
3005.description: As introduced, affirms the ability of an LEA to establish uniform standards and implementation of COVID-19 health and safety protocols; provides immunity to an LEA and certain officials from civil actions regarding the establishment and implementation of such standards and protocols made in good faith. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 49.

3006.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3006.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 29; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 50; Title 56; Title 58; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to COVID-19.
3006.description: As introduced, prohibits a person from requiring another individual to receive a COVID-19 vaccine that is allowed under emergency use authorization or undergoing safety trials; creates cause of action to allow individuals to file suit for a violation. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 29; Title 33; Title 37; Title 49; Title 50; Title 56; Title 58; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

3010.title: AN ACT to make appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of the state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2021, in the administration, operation, and maintenance of the legislative, executive, and judicial branches of the various departments, institutions, offices, and agencies of the state; for certain state aid and obligations; for capital outlay, for the service of the public debt, for emergency and contingency; to repeal certain appropriations and any acts inconsistent herewith; to provide provisional continuing appropriations; and to establish certain provisions, limitations, and restrictions under which appropriations may be obligated and expended. This act makes appropriations for the purposes described above for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2021.
3010.description: As enacted, makes appropriations sufficient to provide the first year's funding for any act which receives final passage during the third extraordinary session of the 112th General Assembly.

3011.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8; Title 16 and Title 17, relative to a district attorney general peremptorily refusing to prosecute all instances of a criminal offense without regard to facts or circumstances.
3011.description: As enacted, allows the attorney general and reporter to petition the supreme court for appointment of a district attorney general pro tem if a district attorney general peremptorily and categorically refuses to prosecute all instances of a criminal offense without regard to facts or circumstances; requires the supreme court to appoint a district attorney general pro tem if the court finds the district attorney general has refused to attend and prosecute according to law. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16 and Title 17.

3012.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 2, relative to partisan elections for school board members.
3012.description: As enacted, authorizes partisan elections for school board members. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

3013.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9, Chapter 4, relative to the collateral pledged to secure public deposits.
3013.description: As enacted, adds cash as a form of eligible collateral for purposes of the collateral required to be pledged to secure public deposits; decreases the collateral pledge level for public deposits held by collateral pool banks. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

3014.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 6 and Title 58, Chapter 2, relative to executive actions regarding emergencies.
3014.description: As introduced, requires the attorney general and reporter to seek a writ of mandamus or injunction from a court of competent jurisdiction to compel a public official who knowingly refuses to enforce and execute the orders and rules issued in an emergency to do so; requires the attorney general and reporter to seek a civil penalty of no more than $10,000 for failure to enforce or execute emergency orders and rules and an additional $1,000 per day that the official refuses to comply with the writ of mandamus or injunction. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

3015.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 1, relative to executive actions by the governor under the governor's emergency powers.
3015.description: As enacted, decreases the time a state of emergency may continue under an executive order or proclamation issued by the governor from 60 days to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 1.

3016.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 14; Title 58; Title 68, Chapter 2 and Chapter 550 of the Public Acts of 2021, relative to public health.
3016.description: As enacted, grants governor exclusive jurisdiction to issue orders and directives regarding county health departments during a pandemic; transfers authorization to order rules and regulations as are necessary or appropriate to protect the general health and safety of the county from the county health officer to the county mayor; revises and enacts other provisions regarding the powers and responsibilities of county health departments, county mayors, and county health officers. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 14; Title 58; Title 68, Chapter 2 and Chapter 550 of the Public Acts of 2021.

3017.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9; Title 14; Title 29; Title 38; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to addressing the COVID-19 pandemic.
3017.description: As enacted, revises and adds provisions relative to COVID-19; transfers certain existing provisions (such as liability provisions) and adds the new provisions to a newly created title in TCA (Title 14); specifies that the provisions of the newly created title will prevail over any conflicting law; and prohibits the governor from suspending any provision of the newly created title, except in cases where the governor is exercising the governor's emergency powers during a state of emergency declared by the governor; prohibits a governmental entity and other public official from suspending any provision of the newly created title, regardless of whether there is a state of emergency. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 14; Title 29; Title 38; Title 49; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

3018.title: AN ACT relative to addressing the COVID-19 pandemic.
3018.description: As introduced, prohibits a person, private business, or state or local governmental official, entity, department, or agency from compelling proof of vaccination for COVID-19; prohibits an employer from taking an adverse action against an employee, or from failing to hire an applicant, based solely on the employee's or applicant's refusal to provide proof of vaccination for COVID-19.

3019.last_action: P2C, ref. to Covid-19 Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3019.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 11; Title 13; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68, relative to uniform standards for persons subject to COVID-19 vaccination requirements.
3019.description: As introduced, establishes uniform standards for persons subject to COVID-19 vaccination requirements. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 11; Title 13; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

3021.last_action: P2C, ref. to Emergency Orders Committee of Extraordinary Session III
3021.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 58; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to emergencies.
3021.description: As introduced, reduces from 60 to 30 days the duration of a declared state of emergency by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 58; Title 63 and Title 68.

3022.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 29; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 56; Title 58; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to COVID-19.
3022.description: As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Medical Bill of Rights Act." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 29; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 56; Title 58; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
