4714.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9; Title 41 and Title 49, Chapter 4, relative to the Tennessee Reconnect program.
4714.description: As introduced, changes from every four years to every three years, the frequency of study of Tennessee Reconnect program conducted by comptroller of the treasury. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 41 and Title 49, Chapter 4.

4724.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6, relative to law enforcement.
4724.description: As introduced, authorizes law enforcement agencies to use a drone without a search warrant to provide or enhance security for a public event, including a concert, athletic event, festival, protest, or other outdoor event; extends the time within which law enforcement must determine whether evidence collected by a drone may be retained or deleted from three to 30 days. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6.

4729.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16, relative to certificates of need.
4729.description: As introduced, creates a process by which the owner of a hospital closed for 15 years or less may submit an application to the health services and development agency to resume operations without a certificate of need in certain circumstances; requires the HSDA to review and notify the applicant of its determination within 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

4735.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
4735.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 57, relative to identification for alcohol sales.
4735.description: As introduced, requires persons buying beer who appear younger than 50 years of age to present proof of age to a beer retailer, rather than all persons buying beer. - Amends TCA Title 57.

4833.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6, relative to sex education.
4833.description: As introduced, expands family life education throughout the state by requiring each LEA to develop, adopt, and implement a family life curriculum instead of only LEAs located in a county with a pregnancy rate that exceeds 19.5 pregnancies for every 1,000 females 15 through 17 years of age; prohibits a person from making abortion referrals or from advocating or encouraging abortion while present on school property. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

4882.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
4882.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 1, relative to performance goals and assessment.
4882.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner to obtain approval from the state board of education before making any changes to the performance goals and measures for schools and LEAs; requires the commissioner to convene a working group to obtain stakeholder input on any proposed change to the performance goals and measures before seeking approval from the state board. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.

4902.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Transportation and Safety Committee
4902.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 8, relative to high occupancy vehicle lanes.
4902.description: As introduced, urges department of transportation to study and report to the transportation committee of the house of representatives and transportation and safety committee of the senate on or before February 1, 2022, as to the overall impact of the utilization of HOV lanes on air quality, including any potential reductions in the gas emissions that are attributable to congestion reduction and the use of HOV lanes by ILEVs and LEEEVs resulting from the program; authorizes department to consult with the departments of revenue and environment and conservation in preparing this report. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

4908.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 66, Chapter 35, relative to local housing regulations.
4908.description: As introduced, removes the statewide prohibition on local governments enacting rent control and inclusionary zoning regulations. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 35.

4964.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 58; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9, relative to tuition.
4964.description: As introduced, requires the commission to include information concerning in-state and out-of-state tuition rates charged by public higher education institutions in the eight states bordering Tennessee to aid in assessing tuition affordability. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 58; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

5020.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 41, Chapter 21, relative to the Eleonora Legacy Act.
5020.description: As introduced, enacts the "Eleonora Legacy Act," requiring correctional facilities to provide mammograms and information about preventative healthcare measures to inmates. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.

5021.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
5021.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 13 and Title 66, relative to residential rental property.
5021.description: As introduced, requires landlords to provide applicants for tenancy of dwelling units with written notice of the landlord's tenant selection criteria and the grounds for which a rental application may be denied; requires refund of an applicant's application fee, security deposit, and other fee or deposit if such information is not provided. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 66.

5051.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
5051.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to healthcare providers.
5051.description: As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the time within which a person issued a certificate of registration by the division of health related boards must notify the division of a change of address to receive a duplicate registration certificate. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

5071.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 57, Chapter 3, relative to retail food store wine licensees.
5071.description: As introduced, redefines "retail food store" for purposes of the retail food store wine license. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

5161.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41, relative to witnesses.
5161.description: As introduced, creates the Tennessee witness relocation and protection program to be administered by the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

5178.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 7 and Title 13, Chapter 14, relative to development districts.
5178.description: As introduced, adds the chairs of the government operations committees of the senate and the house of representatives to the list of persons who are to receive annual activity reports from development district boards. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7 and Title 13, Chapter 14.

5185.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33 and Title 37, Chapter 1, relative to an injectable naltrexone pilot program.
5185.description: As introduced, requires the department to create a pilot program for qualifying parents with children referred to a zero to three court program to provide the parents with access to injectable naltrexone. - Amends TCA Title 33 and Title 37, Chapter 1.

5200.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk. Local Bill
5200.title: AN ACT to amend Chapter 43 of the Private Acts of 2003; and any other acts amendatory thereto, relative to the hotel occupancy tax in the Town of Carthage.
5200.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes the legislative body to adopt rules and regulations for the implementation and administration of the hotel motel tax, including the collection and remittance of the tax by a hotel operator and liability of such operator for delinquent tax payments. - Amends Chapter 43 of the Private Acts of 2003.

5210.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Commerce & Labor Committee
5210.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 10; Title 47; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to health care.
5210.description: As introduced, expands definition of pet to include nondomesticated animals for the purpose of authorizing insurers to offer group or individual policies or contracts that provide benefits for hospital and medical services for those animals. - Amends TCA Title 10; Title 47; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

5220.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Finance, Ways & Means Revenue Subcommittee
5220.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 67, Chapter 6, relative to temporary tax relief for certain retailers and businesses.
5220.description: As introduced, authorizes qualifying retailers in the restaurant and other eating places industry or the mobile food services industry, and other retail businesses that have lost at least 25 percent in revenue, to temporarily deduct up to $50,000 of net taxable sales from their monthly state sales tax return and retain the resulting state sales tax revenue. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

5398.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
5398.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 32, Part 3, relative to the state board for licensing alarm systems contractors.
5398.description: As introduced, extends the state board for licensing alarm systems contractors to June 30, 2022. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 32, Part 3.

5545.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5545.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3 and Title 4, relative to unconstitutional federal laws.
5545.description: As introduced, authorizes the joint government operations committee of the general assembly to review a federal law, rule, or executive order to determine whether it was lawfully enacted or issued under the Constitution of the United States; authorizes the joint committee to submit its findings and recommendations to the governor, each member of the general assembly, and the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 4.

5558.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5558.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 39-17-1309 and Section 39-17-1350, relative to law enforcement officers.
5558.description: As introduced, removes requirement that an off-duty law enforcement officer notify principal or other administrative staff person if the off-duty officer will be present on school grounds or inside school building during regular school hours and in possession of a firearm. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1309 and Section 39-17-1350.

5644.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 3, Part 1, relative to polling places.
5644.description: As introduced, requires county election commissions to prioritize public buildings as polling places for elections; prohibits political events during early voting and on election day on property for which any portion is used as a polling place, regardless of the distance of the event from the polling place. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3, Part 1.

5656.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5656.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 9, Chapter 23, relative to tax increment financing.
5656.description: As introduced, requires the comptroller of the treasury to develop a numerical grading system for all tax increment financing (TIF) plans; requires the comptroller to evaluate TIF plans based on the benefits the municipality is receiving from the plan and the cost of the active plan to the taxpayers in the jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 23.

5716.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5716.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68, relative to utility providers.
5716.description: As introduced, increases from 90 days to 120 days after the receipt of an offer the time within which an electric cooperative shall signify in writing its acknowledgement of an offer by an annexing municipality to purchase an electric cooperative's electric distribution properties and service rights within an annexed area. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.

5778.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
5778.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 47, Chapter 18, relative to veterans.
5778.description: As introduced, makes it a violation of the Consumer Protection Act to represent that goods or services are being offered at a price or on terms available only to veterans while offering the same price or terms to non-veterans. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

5801.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
5801.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, relative to chiropractors.
5801.description: As introduced, allows chiropractors to complete annually required continuing education courses via remote learning; prohibits the board of chiropractic examiners from denying accreditation to or attendee credit for a continuing education course solely on the basis that the course can be completed via remote learning. - Amends TCA Title 63.

5813.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
5813.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to child care.
5813.description: As introduced, authorizes the department to take action necessary to support the development of shared services alliances and child care networks in this state; authorizes the department to contract with one or more entities to accomplish such development. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.

5877.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Transportation and Safety Committee
5877.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1; Title 55, Chapter 6; Title 67, Chapter 3; Title 67, Chapter 4; Title 67, Chapter 6 and Chapter 181 of the Public Acts of 2017, relative to the use of revenues derived from increased taxes and fees for a project in Smith County, Tennessee.
5877.description: As introduced, adds I-40 Exit 258 in Smith County to the list of projects to be developed with revenues derived from the increased taxes and fees imposed by the IMPROVE Act. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1; Title 55, Chapter 6; Title 67, Chapter 3; Title 67, Chapter 4; Title 67, Chapter 6 and Chapter 181 of the Public Acts of 2017.

5915.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5915.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4 and Title 36, relative to secular humanism.
5915.description: As introduced, prohibits this state and any political subdivision of this state, or any official of this state or a political subdivision, from creating, enforcing, or endorsing policies that respect or promote non-secular self-asserted sex-based identity narratives, sexual orientation orthodoxy, or non-secular marriage doctrine because the policies fail the Lemon test, as established by the United States Supreme Court in Lemon v. Kurtzman, 403 U.S. 602 (1971). - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 36.

5944.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
5944.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4 and Title 49, relative to the state office of racial equity.
5944.description: As introduced, creates the state office of racial equity. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 49.

5960.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
5960.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to the disposal of controlled substances and prescription drugs.
5960.description: As introduced, requires the board of pharmacy and the board for licensing health care facilities to promulgate rules to establish certain guidelines for pharmacies and facilities to provide for disposal of unused controlled substances and prescription drugs. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

5995.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5995.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 4-1-412; Title 4, Chapter 8; and Title 4, Chapter 11, relative to heritage protection.
5995.description: As introduced, makes a violation of the heritage protection laws by a public official a Class C misdemeanor and holds such official personally liable for penalties and fines arising from such violation. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-412; Title 4, Chapter 8; and Title 4, Chapter 11.

5998.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5998.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 8, Chapter 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, relative to a statewide 24/7 sobriety program.
5998.description: As introduced, creates a statewide 24/7 sobriety program to be administered by the office of the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

6007.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6007.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, relative to student journalism.
6007.description: As introduced, enacts the "Good News for Students Act," which declares that, except in certain limited circumstances, a student journalist at a public institution of higher education has the right to exercise freedom of speech and freedom of the press in institution-sponsored media. - Amends TCA Title 49.

6064.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
6064.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4 and Section 38-6-114, relative to the Tennessee economic council on women.
6064.description: As introduced, reinstitutes the Tennessee economic council on women. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Section 38-6-114.

6096.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6096.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 3; Title 4 and Title 8, relative to oaths of public officials.
6096.description: As introduced, requires that the oath of a public official be filed with the secretary of state or county clerk, as applicable, within one week of the administration of the oath. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 8.

6115.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6115.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2; Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 1; Title 43 and Title 44, relative to animals.
6115.description: As introduced, increases the minimum fine amount for the offense of failing to provide a written receipt for the cremation of animal remains from $500 to $600. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2; Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 1; Title 43 and Title 44.

6153.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6153.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 38, Chapter 8, relative to hiring of law enforcement officers.
6153.description: As introduced, enacts the "Public Safety Through Hiring Act" to prohibit law enforcement agencies from hiring officers with a history of certain misconduct. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8.

6216.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, relative to voting.
6216.description: As introduced, abolishes early voting; prohibits the use of voting machines; requires elections to be conducted with watermarked paper ballots that are hand-marked by the voter. - Amends TCA Title 2.

6219.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6219.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 54; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Section 50-1-312; Title 55 and Title 70, relative to firearms.
6219.description: As introduced, changes from February 1 to March 1 the due date for the TBI's annual report to the general assembly on the amount of money collected for handgun carry permit fees in excess of the costs associated with conducting background checks. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 54; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Section 50-1-312; Title 55 and Title 70.

6255.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6255.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 40, relative to the restoration of voting rights.
6255.description: As introduced, requires that the written statement accompanying a certificate of voting rights restoration and explaining the procedure to apply for a voter registration card and become eligible to vote, be available in the languages most commonly spoken in this state. - Amends TCA Title 40.

6256.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate State & Local Government Committee
6256.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2; Title 39 and Title 40, relative to voting.
6256.description: As introduced, increases time a county election commission must determine opening time for all convenient voting centers in the county from at least 15 days before an election to at least 20 days before an election. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 39 and Title 40.

6259.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6259.title: AN ACT, relative to commerce.
6259.description: As introduced, authorizes a nonprofit cooperative protective association engaged in the production of sheep to submit its annual report to the commissioner of commerce and insurance in electronic format.

6351.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk. Local Bill
6351.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 67-4-1425, relative to tax upon the privilege of occupancy in any city having a population of not less than four hundred seventy (470) nor more than four hundred eighty (480) that is located within a county having a population of not less than thirteen thousand seven hundred (13,700) nor more than thirteen thousand seven hundred fifty (13,750), according to the 2010 federal census or any subsequent federal census.
6351.description: As introduced, authorizes the City of Beersheba Springs in Grundy County to levy a privilege tax of up to 3 percent upon the privilege of occupancy by a two-thirds vote of its governing body. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-1425.

6368.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate State and Local Government Committee
6368.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 8, Chapter 50, relative to the disclosure of ownership of certain entities.
6368.description: As introduced, requires a person who is a public official or a candidate for public office to disclose the percentage ownership of a business organization that receives public funds from this state or a political subdivision of this state if the person's ownership interest is 10 percent or more. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 8, Chapter 50.

6396.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 55, Chapter 50, relative to driver services.
6396.description: As introduced, enacts the "DMV Modernization Act of 2022"; requires department of safety to issue licenses to third-party service providers to perform certain driver services, such as the issuance of driver licenses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

6514.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6514.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 49-8-105, relative to training schools.
6514.description: As introduced, removes the restriction that state colleges or universities may only contract with a local school board within the county or city in which the state college or university is located to operate a training school for pre-kindergarten through grade 12. - Amends TCA Section 49-8-105.

6626.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 37, Chapter 2, Part 4, relative to services for youth transitioning from foster care to adulthood.
6626.description: As introduced, requires, rather than permits, the department to provide services on a voluntary basis to any person who was in the custody of the department at the time of the person's eighteenth birthday and who also meets other conditions. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 2, Part 4.

6629.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 57, relative to local option elections for alcohol sales.
6629.description: As introduced, removes population requirements for a municipality to hold a referendum on the sale of alcoholic beverages; requires a municipality to maintain a police department or enter into an agreement for the provision of law enforcement during the hours of sale of alcoholic beverages to be eligible to hold a referendum on the sale of alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57.

6675.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Transportation and Safety Committee
6675.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 55-9-402 and Title 65, Chapter 15, Part 3, relative to transportation network companies.
6675.description: As introduced, requires a driver for a transportation network company to maintain an illuminated sign, or a sticker in a standard position, on the driver's vehicle that clearly indicates that the vehicle is being used for prearranged rides for the company. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-402 and Title 65, Chapter 15, Part 3.

6758.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 39 and Title 50, relative to criminal offenses.
6758.description: As introduced, creates a Class E felony of an employer influencing or attempting to influence an employee who is a public servant in the performance of their official duties as a public servant by means of coercion; creates a cause of action for unlawful discharge of an employee who is a public servant. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 39 and Title 50.

6796.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
6796.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, relative to medical professions.
6796.description: As introduced, extends from 30 to 60 days, the amount of time an officer in the commissioned dental corps who resigns or is honorably discharged from the army, navy, air force, or the public health service of the United States and engages in the practice of dentistry or dental hygiene in this state or another state has to apply for expedited registration with the board of dentistry to avoid normal registration requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.

6893.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Energy, Ag., and Nat. Resources Committee
6893.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 70, relative to the taking of aquatic creatures.
6893.description: As introduced, specifies that a person is not required to attend a trotline on a day that the national weather service has declared a flash flood watch or flash flood warning for any part of the county where the body of water in which the trotline is set is located. - Amends TCA Title 70.

6940.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68, relative to the availability of healthcare personnel in healthcare facilities during a healthcare staffing crisis.
6940.description: As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of health and the commissioner of mental health and substance abuse services to allow certain rules to not be applied to certain healthcare professionals and students in order for those persons to operate outside of normal licensure requirements during a healthcare staffing crisis; requires certain notice to governor and speakers of the senate and house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.

7067.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29 and Title 55, relative to speed limits on county roads.
7067.description: As introduced, specifies that a county is immune from liability for a cause of action or claim for damages arising out of an accident occurring on a county road for which the governing body of the county has lowered the speed limit to less than 55 miles per hour. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 55.

7200.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
7200.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 7, Chapter 51, relative to grants by local governments.
7200.description: As introduced, authorizes a local government to create a program to incentivize medical professionals, police officers, firefighters, and teachers to live and work within the boundaries of the local government by providing grants to such professionals in an amount that is equal to the amount of property tax due on such person's principal residence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

7511.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 5; Section 68-11-209 and Section 71-3-107, relative to the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act.
7511.description: As introduced, changes the rule review authority in the house of representatives from the government operations committee to the appropriate standing committee as determined by the topic of the rule by the chief clerk of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Section 68-11-209 and Section 71-3-107.

7658.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
7658.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49 and Title 68, relative to K-12 education funding.
7658.description: As introduced, requires, beginning with the 2021-2022 school year, the BEP formula to fund at least one full-time school nurse position and one full-time school counselor position for each school in an LEA; increases, beginning with the 2021-2022 school year, the number of regular education teaching positions funded through the BEP. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.

7669.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 37; Title 49; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to disease prevention by educational authorities.
7669.description: As introduced, authorizes LEAs, charter schools, and public institutions of higher education to develop and implement contact tracing procedures; prohibits contact tracing procedures for COVID-19. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 37; Title 49; Title 68 and Title 71.

7686.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk.
7686.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 9; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, relative to COVID-19.
7686.description: As introduced, requires a healthcare professional to provide a patient who has a positive COVID-19 test result, or a patient seeking a COVID-19 vaccine, with certain information; places certain restrictions on the department of health concerning the usage of American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 funds. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 33; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

7687.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk.
7687.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49 and Title 68, relative to vaccinations.
7687.description: As introduced, prohibits the commissioner of health from requiring the immunization of children with a vaccine that has emergency use authorization from the United States food and drug administration; expands the prohibition on requiring proof of vaccination as a condition of entering upon the premises of a governmental entity to include the premises of private businesses. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.

7691.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 8 and Title 58, Chapter 2, relative to emergency powers.
7691.description: As introduced, specifies that during a public health emergency the governor does not have the authority to control the actions or movements of private citizens; specifies that the governor's power is limited to controlling the actions and movements of governmental entities and personnel. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

7714.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 50; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68, relative to COVID-19.
7714.description: As introduced, prohibits discrimination based on a person's vaccination status for COVID-19 or possession of a vaccine passport showing either immunity to or vaccination from COVID-19; prohibits the use of public funds, personnel, or property to implement or enforce a federal law, executive order, rule, or regulation that, in the judgment of the attorney general, has the effect of discriminating against a person based on the person's vaccination status, violates the 10th Amendment of the U.S. Constitution, or harms this state's economy; requires the attorney general to review laws at the request of members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 50; Title 58, Chapter 2 and Title 68.

7733.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk.
7733.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68, relative to employee rights.
7733.description: As introduced, authorizes employees of public and private employers to refuse a requirement by the employer that the employee receive a vaccine, immunization, or other medication as a condition of employment based on the employee's strongly held religious beliefs or right of conscience; requires an employee to provide the employer with written notice of the employee's refusal based on such grounds. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

7734.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk.
7734.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 68, relative to medical treatment for minors.
7734.description: As introduced, prohibits certain healthcare practitioners from providing medical treatment to a minor without parental consent or an appropriate court order. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 68.

7739.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk.
7739.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 49, Chapter 2, relative to school board elections.
7739.description: As introduced, expands, from only Madison County to all counties, the authorization to recall a local board of education member; decreases from 66 percent to more than 50 percent the amount needed to recall a local board of education member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

7747.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk.
7747.title: AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 63, relative to healthcare providers.
7747.description: As introduced, specifies that a licensed healthcare provider is immune from liability for any cause of action or claim for damages arising out of the provider's treatment of a patient for COVID-19 if the provider acted in good faith and with reasonable care and the patient provided written, informed consent; defines written, informed consent. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 63.
